translated: How do you know? is a rejection.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention is as follows:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni mi shes te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe na ni mi shes te /
translated: When in equipoise, one does not know,

original: zhi ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the inconceivability of peace would be lost.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-concentrated,

original: rnam par rtog pa la yul med pa'i phyir dang / de med par 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yul med pa'i phyir dang / de med par 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because conceptualization has no object, and because grasping what is nonexistent is delusion.

original: zhi ba ni nang dang phyi'i nye bar zhi gnas 'gyur ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni nang dang phyi'i nye bar zhi gnas 'gyur ba med pa yin te /
translated: Tranquility is the unchanging inner and outer pacification of the mind.

original: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //üîΩbtsun pa sha radva ti'i bu gal te /
analyzed: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no // btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu gal te /
translated: That is the inconceivable meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing dmigs na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni 'dri ba mi 'thad pas na 'dir yang shin tu bsam gyis
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing dmigs na ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni 'dri ba mi 'thad pas na 'dir yang shin tu bsam gyis
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, if this inconceivable meditative stabilization existed and was apprehended, then there would be another meditative stabilization even more tranquil than this inconceivable meditative stabilization.

original: mi khyab pa nyid sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mi khyab pa nyid sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Since the question is untenable, here too the inconceivable is applied.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If means if it were so.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing de mi dmigs na ni de'i tshe bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di bas ches zhi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ba rigs pa yin na ji tsam du ting nge 'dzin de la med cing mi
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing de mi dmigs na ni de'i tshe bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di bas ches zhi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ba rigs pa yin na ji tsam du ting nge 'dzin de la med cing mi
translated: If this inconceivable concentration exists and is not observed, then at that time it is reasonable to ask, ‚ÄúIs this inconceivable concentration more peaceful than that?‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa yin na 'dri ba'i don de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dmigs pa yin na 'dri ba'i don de ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: But if that concentration does not exist and is not observed to any degree, how could the meaning of the question be tenable?

original: sha radva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sha radva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said,

original: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin med cing 'di ltar mi dmigs pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus kyang 'di'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin par tshig zur gyis 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin med cing 'di ltar mi dmigs pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus kyang 'di'i dmigs pa med pa nyid yin par tshig zur gyis 'dri ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, is the inconceivable concentration non-existent and not observed?‚Äù ≈öƒÅriputra indirectly asks whether it is non-apprehensible.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i phyir med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i phyir med pa yin te /
translated: Because it is not observed, it does not exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad ni dmigs pa sngon du song ba can yin gyi med pa dang yod pa'i tha snyad sngon du song ba'i dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad ni dmigs pa sngon du song ba can yin gyi med pa dang yod pa'i tha snyad sngon du song ba'i dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: The conventions of existence and nonexistence are preceded by observation, but they are not preceded by the conventions of nonexistence and existence.

original: gzhan dag @57a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag @57a * //
translated: OthersüîΩare nonexistent.

original: ni med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ni med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: mi dmigs so zhes kyang 'chad do //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes kyang 'chad do //
translated: they are not observed.

original: 'dir ji ltar de med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar de med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how are they nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di ltar de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di ltar de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, it is like this: that is inconceivable samƒÅdhi.‚Äù

original: de bsam du med pa yin na ;
analyzed: de bsam du med pa yin na ;
translated: If that is inconceivable,

original: de ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: how can it exist?

original: bsam du med pa nyid yin pa des na /
analyzed: bsam du med pa nyid yin pa des na /
translated: Since it is inconceivable,

original: 'di ni med de mi dmigs pa yin no //üîΩdmigs pa rnams dngos po med par bstan na /
analyzed: 'di ni med de mi dmigs pa yin no // dmigs pa rnams dngos po med par bstan na /
translated: it is nonexistent and not observed.üîΩHaving taught that observations are nonexistent,

original: mtshan nyid med pa rnams mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa rnams mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that the signless are signs,üîΩit is said,

original: de lta mod kyi btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa ni su yang med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa ni su yang med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, there is no one who has not attained the inconceivable meditative stabilization.‚Äù

original: so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: There is no one, whether an ordinary person

original: gzhan gang yang rung ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mi thob pa su yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di mi thob pa su yang med do //
translated: or anyone else, who has not attained this inconceivable meditative stabilization.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyi tsher ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyi tsher ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin no//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yin no//
translated: but all sentient beings have attained the inconceivable meditative stabilization.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?üîΩBecause all sentient beings are the same in having a single characteristic, which is the absence of characteristics.

original: sems can thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med pa nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / gtan tshigs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med pa nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / gtan tshigs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'di ltar bsam pa thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn this way, all thoughts are inconceivable,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bsam bya ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i bsam bya ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: Because the object of thought imagined by the childish is inconceivable.

original: bsam bya'i dngos po dang bral ba yin te dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam bya'i dngos po dang bral ba yin te dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: It is free from the entity of the object of thought, it is non-entity.

original: de lta bu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir / gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is inconceivable is the inconceivable samƒÅdhi.‚Äù

original: bsam bya dben pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bsam bya dben pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This solitude of the object of thought is the characteristic of the inconceivable samƒÅdhi.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir bsam pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir bsam pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the entity of thought does not exist,

original: don des na sems can thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa'o rjes mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: don des na sems can thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa'o rjes mjug bsdus so //
translated: by that meaning, all sentient beings have attained this inconceivable samƒÅdhi.

original: de ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa rnams kyis gang bsam pa de ni dngos po yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa rnams kyis gang bsam pa de ni dngos po yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, what is thought by ordinary beings and noble ones does not exist as an entity.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par so sor rtog cing bsam du med pa rgyun du dran pa las zhi ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par so sor rtog cing bsam du med pa rgyun du dran pa las zhi ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: That knowledge which has the aspect of peace, which is the continuous mindfulness of the inconceivable, which is the discernment of all phenomena as selfless, is the inconceivable meditative stabilization.

original: dngos po med pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The object is the non-existent.

original: dran pa ni bdag po yin no //
analyzed: dran pa ni bdag po yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is mindfulness.üîΩThe characteristic is the single characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid @57b med pa ni mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no zhes bshad pa dang bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas legs so zhes sbyin pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid @57b med pa ni mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no zhes bshad pa dang bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas legs so zhes sbyin pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, being pleased, gave the gift of ‚ÄúExcellent!‚Äù to Manjushri, saying, ‚ÄúManjushri, you have spoken well about this profound, profound topic.‚Äù

original: zab mo zab pa'i zhes bya ba lan gnyis su 'byung ba ni sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zab mo zab pa'i zhes bya ba lan gnyis su 'byung ba ni sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba'o //
translated: The repetition of ‚Äúprofound, profound‚Äù is to avoid the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: gnas ni log par rtog pa rnams kyi gnas so //
analyzed: gnas ni log par rtog pa rnams kyi gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTopic‚Äù is the basis of misconceptions.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch as this‚Äù means difficult to understand.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to what was just taught.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa la sogs pa snga ma rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa la sogs pa snga ma rnams te /
translated: All refers to the former aspects of meditative concentration, such as the branches, objective supports, and aspects.

original: de dag khyod kyis log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bstan cing bshad pa legs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag khyod kyis log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bstan cing bshad pa legs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is excellent that you have taught and explained them in order to dispel the wrong ideas of others.

original: 'o na de ltar gnas de lta bu shes par dka' ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gnas de lta bu shes par dka' ba yin na /
translated: If meditative concentration is difficult to understand in this way,üîΩhow can Manjusri teach it?

original: 'jam dpal gyis de ji ltar ston zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis de ji ltar ston zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt,

original: de ltar yang srid pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang srid pa yin te /
translated: it is possible that

original: 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste /
translated: Manjusri, you have served the conquerors of the past

original: mi dmigs pa tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa'o zhes gsungs te /üîΩde ltar yang srid pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsal ba 'am zhal gyis bzhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa'o zhes gsungs te / de ltar yang srid pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsal ba 'am zhal gyis bzhes pa ste /
translated: and practiced pure conduct for a long time without apprehending anything.üîΩIt is possible that is an explanation or an assertion.

original: de lta bu 'chad pa yin par gsal bar srid ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu 'chad pa yin par gsal bar srid ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is clear that such an explanation is possible.

original: zab mo'i chos shes pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i ched du gang gis sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byas shing bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos shes pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i ched du gang gis sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byas shing bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is so called because he has performed and generated the wholesome roots in the presence of the Victorious Ones of the past, etc., for the sake of knowing the profound Dharma and teaching it.

original: tshangs pa ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: Brahma is the absence of faults.

original: de'i ched du spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ched du spyod pa ni tshangs par spyod pa ste /
translated: The conduct for the sake of that is pure conduct.

original: mi dmigs par gang gis yun ring du spyad pa de la de skad ces bya bas khyod kyis bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs par gang gis yun ring du spyad pa de la de skad ces bya bas khyod kyis bstan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He is so called because he has practiced that for a long time without objectification. You have taught that.

original: des na sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing mi dmigs par bsgom pa mchog tu gyur pa ni zab mo'i chos ston pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing mi dmigs par bsgom pa mchog tu gyur pa ni zab mo'i chos ston pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the supreme cultivation of the roots of virtue in the Buddha and the cultivation of non-objectification are the reasons for teaching the profound Dharma.

original: da ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show his own nature,

original: de ltar na 'jam dpal khyod ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jam dpal khyod ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Thus, Manjushri, do you abide in the perfection of wisdom

original: de skad smras so zhes de skad sems sam zhes 'dri ste /
analyzed: de skad smras so zhes de skad sems sam zhes 'dri ste /
translated: and speak thus? He asks this, thinking, Do you think this?

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba mi dmigs par spyod pa yin pa de ltar na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba mi dmigs par spyod pa yin pa de ltar na zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus means in that way, which is the way of practicing non-apprehension.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te sngar bstan pa'i ngo bo de skad smras so zhes sems kyi kun tu rgyu ba de snyam sems pa 'byung ngam zhes de skad @58a * //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te sngar bstan pa'i ngo bo de skad smras so zhes sems kyi kun tu rgyu ba de snyam sems pa 'byung ngam zhes de skad @58a * //
translated: What is a question.

original: dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag dris pa'i ngo bo de lta bu'i sems 'byung na ni de'i tshe gzung 'dzin du dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag dris pa'i ngo bo de lta bu'i sems 'byung na ni de'i tshe gzung 'dzin du dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: Having abided in the perfection of wisdom, the thought I have spoken in that way - such a thought would arise. When asked in that way, the answer is: Blessed One, if such a thought were to arise in me, the one who asks, then I would be abiding in the apprehension of subject and object.

original: de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
translated: That would be the way I would speak.

original: dmigs pa la spyod na ni dmigs pa spyod pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod na ni dmigs pa spyod pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one practices with reference points, one's practice with reference points will decline.

original: dmigs pa la spyod pa 'di'i 'bras bu mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod pa 'di'i 'bras bu mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to briefly teach the result of practicing with reference points,

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa la gnas pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa la gnas pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: Abiding in the perception of self... and so on.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su brtags pa dang / de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtags pa phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su brtags pa dang / de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis brtags pa phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: The so-called self is the self imagined by the heterodox to have the nature of being permanent, etc. , and the self imagined by the bodhisattvas who have not yet seen reality to be the nature of the aggregates, etc.

original: de gnyi ga yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Both of these are the bases of the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: de la 'du shes pa ni kun tu rtog pa dang rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du shes pa ni kun tu rtog pa dang rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The conception of these is imagination and conceit.

original: nas zhes bya ba'i sgras sems can dang srog la sogs pa'i 'du shes bsdu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: nas zhes bya ba'i sgras sems can dang srog la sogs pa'i 'du shes bsdu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù in the verse includes the conception of sentient beings, life, etc., and also the conception of defilement and purification, etc.

original: de dag ni 'dir rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dir rgyu yin no //
translated: These are the causes here.

original: dngos po'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes te /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes te /
translated: The conception of things is the conception of form, etc.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the effect.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa dmigs pa bstan pa 'dis ni mi dmigs par spyod pa dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa dmigs pa bstan pa 'dis ni mi dmigs par spyod pa dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: This explanation of the object together with its result shows the contradiction with the practice of non-apprehension.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize,

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar 'dris pa'i dmigs pa'i bdag nyid smras pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bas /
analyzed: sngar 'dris pa'i dmigs pa'i bdag nyid smras pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal bas /
translated: The previously mentioned object-nature of acquaintance is contradictory to the perfection of wisdom, the nature of non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Therefore, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di skad mi 'chi'o //
analyzed: 'di skad mi 'chi'o //
translated: one should not speak in this way.

original: 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the contradiction,

original: ci'i slad du zhen bcom ldan 'das gal te /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhen bcom ldan 'das gal te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhy is it so, Blessed One? If

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas so snyam bgyid cing gnas par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i ngo bo'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas so snyam bgyid cing gnas par rtog pa'am /
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄòI am abiding in the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,‚Äô and abides with that conception,

original: 'on te mi gnas so snyam bgyid cing mi gnas par rnam par rtog pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te mi gnas so snyam bgyid cing mi gnas par rnam par rtog pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags par 'gyur te /
translated: Or if it is thought that it does not abide, and if it is thought that it does not abide, it would not be the perfection of wisdom.üîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de las phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or if you think it does not abide, then it would not be the perfection of wisdom, because it would be the opposite of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: This is a promise.üîΩThe reasoning that establishes this is as follows:

original: 'di la 'thad pa sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa ni gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das bdag la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'thad pa sgrub par byed pa'i rigs pa ni gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das bdag la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúAbiding in the self is abiding in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gnas pa @58b med pa kun nas slong ba med pa 'byung ba med pa ltar gnas de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas pa @58b med pa kun nas slong ba med pa 'byung ba med pa ltar gnas de yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is no abiding, no motivation, and no arising, so too is that abiding.

original: chos gang yang gnas pa med pa des na gnas kyang de yin te /
analyzed: chos gang yang gnas pa med pa des na gnas kyang de yin te /
translated: Since there is no abiding in any dharma, that is also the abiding.

original: bsam du med pa'i gnas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam du med pa'i gnas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The abiding in the inconceivable is the abiding in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: bdag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnas pa dang 'dra bas bdag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la gnas pa dang 'dra bas bdag la gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in the self‚Äù means that it is like abiding in the self, so it is called ‚Äúabiding in the self.‚Äù

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag la gnas pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the practice of the self?

original: gnas pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be non-practice.

original: bdag yod par gnas pa 'di yod pa ma yin pas gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yod par gnas pa 'di yod pa ma yin pas gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Since the practice of the self as existent does not exist, it is non-practice.

original: yang na 'dir gnas pas na gnas so //
analyzed: yang na 'dir gnas pas na gnas so //
translated: Or, it is practice because one practices here.

original: de lta bu ma yin pa ni gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pa ni gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is non-practice.

original: de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i kun nas slong pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i kun nas slong pa med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be without motivation.

original: 'dis kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur slong bar 'gyur bas na kun nas slong ba ste kun nas slong bar byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur slong bar 'gyur bas na kun nas slong ba ste kun nas slong bar byed pa la bya'o //
translated: Since this is the origination and the instigation, it is motivation. It is said to be the instigator.

original: de gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni kun nas slong ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: de gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni kun nas slong ba med pa'o ;
translated: Since it does not exist in that, it is without motivation.

original: / de bas na kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /üîΩkun nas 'byung ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: / de bas na kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir / kun nas 'byung ba med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because there is no cause for instigation,üîΩthere is no origination.

original: skye ba med do //
analyzed: skye ba med do //
translated: There is no arising.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rin po che za ma tog las kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa ni bdag yin na bdag kun nas slong bar byed pa'ang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rin po che za ma tog las kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun nas slong bar byed pa ni bdag yin na bdag kun nas slong bar byed pa'ang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If the self is the instigator of the view of the transitory collection, what is the instigator of the self?

original: bdag ni gang nas kyang ma byung /
analyzed: bdag ni gang nas kyang ma byung /
translated: The self does not come from anywhere.

original: bdag kun nas 'byung bar byed pa'i kun nas 'byung ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag kun nas 'byung bar byed pa'i kun nas 'byung ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The self does not have an instigator that causes it to come.

original: rgyu dang rang gi ngo bo dang las rnams mi 'thad pa'i dpe gnas pa med pa nyid bstan nas don la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rang gi ngo bo dang las rnams mi 'thad pa'i dpe gnas pa med pa nyid bstan nas don la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the nonexistence of the example of endurance, which is untenable in terms of cause, essence, and effect, in order to apply this to the meaning, he says:

original: gnas pa de yang de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That endurance is also like that.

original: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni bdag bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni bdag bzhin du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means like the self.

original: de ni gang la gnas nas bdag de skad du mi mchi'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni gang la gnas nas bdag de skad du mi mchi'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That is to say, the self does not endure in any way.

original: 'dir gnas pas gnas shing zhes brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu de ltar bzhed de bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir gnas pas gnas shing zhes brjod pa'i kun rdzob tu de ltar bzhed de bshad do //
translated: Here, the conventional expression ‚Äúendures by means of endurance‚Äù is accepted in that way and is explained.

original: de ni bsdus pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is a summary verse.

original: dpe'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the dharmas of the example are included in it.

original: 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni chos gang yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /üîΩgzung ba 'am 'dzin pa gang yang gnas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni chos gang yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / gzung ba 'am 'dzin pa gang yang gnas pa'am /
translated: Its differentiation is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúthere is no dharma that endures.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba'am yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'am yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no enduring, arising, or existence of any object or subject.

original: 'dis ni rgyu mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the untenability of the cause.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni chos yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na gnas dang gzhi ni mngon par 'dod pa de yin no //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni chos yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na gnas dang gzhi ni mngon par 'dod pa de yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that because the dharma does not exist, the basis and the ground are not really tenable.

original: 'di ni 'dir mtshan nyid mi 'thad @59a * //üîΩpa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir mtshan nyid mi 'thad @59a * // pa yin te /
translated: Here, the characteristic is untenable.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the support of entities,

original: gnas zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: it is called a basis.

original: 'dir ni dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: But here, because there are no entities,

original: gnas 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: a basis is not tenable.

original: rnam pa de lta bu de ni bsam du ci yang med pas /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu de ni bsam du ci yang med pas /
translated: Since that kind of thing is completely unthinkable,

original: bsam du med pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: bsam du med pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: it is the unthinkable basis.

original: 'dis ni las mi 'thad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las mi 'thad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the untenability of action.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to conclude, the dharmin that is to be established is called the ‚Äúground of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ni gnas yin no zhes tha snyad la brten nas de skad bstan to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni gnas yin no zhes tha snyad la brten nas de skad bstan to //
translated: The nature of that is the ground. This is taught in that way in dependence on the conventions.

original: de dag gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag mnyam pa nyid du mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag mnyam pa nyid du mdor bstan nas /
translated: Those explain the perfection of wisdom and the self as being the same in brief.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don la sna tshogs kyi rnam pa spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don la sna tshogs kyi rnam pa spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to abandon the various aspects with regard to the meaning of thatness, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is called the non-arising of all phenomena‚Äù and so on.

original: chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis shing 'byung ba ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis shing 'byung ba ma mchis pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are non-arising and non-occurring.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags te /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags te /
translated: Non-arising is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de kho na'i don gyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the single entity of the meaning of thatness.

original: rigs dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs dbyer med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the family is undifferentiated,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is this:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rigs de'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rigs de'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is the expression of the inconceivable element, the inconceivable lineage.

original: gzhan zlog pa tha dad par zad kyi 'dir ni tha dad pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan zlog pa tha dad par zad kyi 'dir ni tha dad pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the other [perfections] are only different in the sense of being a reversal of that [inconceivable element],

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Lord] declares, ‚ÄúThat which is the inconceivable element,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang lags pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du yang nges par gzung ba'i don lags te /
analyzed: gang lags pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du yang nges par gzung ba'i don lags te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which‚Äù means that it is always to be understood as a definite reference.

original: gang lags pa de nyid ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags /
analyzed: gang lags pa de nyid ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags /
translated: That which is the inconceivable element is the unarisen element.

original: de nyid chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: That itself is the dharma element,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the qualities of a buddha.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Therefore, the expanse of the perfection of wisdom and the expanse of self are not two,

original: gnyis kyi dngos pos dben pa lags so ;
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos pos dben pa lags so ;
translated: and are devoid of any dualistic thing.

original: / de bas na gnyis su dbyer ma mchis te /
analyzed: / de bas na gnyis su dbyer ma mchis te /
translated: Therefore, they are not divided into two,

original: rnam pa gnyis su bgyir mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su bgyir mi nus so //
translated: and cannot be made into two.üîΩFor the very reason that these two are not two, and are not divided into two,

original: sngar bstan ma thag pa gang gi slad du 'di gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: sngar bstan ma thag pa gang gi slad du 'di gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so //
translated: this is the inconceivable expanse.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gal te 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig skyes te yod par gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig skyes te yod par gyur tam /
translated: If either of these two were to arise and exist,

original: gal te gnyis ka yang ma skyes pa shin tu ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe chos yod pa dag la shes pas yul du ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gnyis ka yang ma skyes pa shin tu ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe chos yod pa dag la shes pas yul du ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: or if both were not to arise and not exist at all, then at that time, because the existent phenomena would not be taken as objects by cognition,

original: phyogs gcig pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa'i shes pa yin par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: it would be a cognition of one part,

original: ma shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ma shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: or it would be non-cognition.

original: yul du byed na ni sems pa yod pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul du byed na ni sems pa yod pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were an object, then it would be conceivable, and that would undermine its inconceivability.

original: gang gi slad du zhes bya ba dang / de'i slad du zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du zhes bya ba dang / de'i slad du zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor what reason‚Äù and ‚Äúon that account‚Äù are the reason.

original: 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so zhes tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩde skad bshad kyi 'dir ni gtan tshigs sam /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so zhes tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas / de skad bshad kyi 'dir ni gtan tshigs sam /
translated: This is the inconceivable realm, as stated from the perspective of conventional truth.

original: bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But here there is not even the slightest reason or probandum.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So it should be applied in the same way to other [statements].

original: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor what reason is this the inconceivable realm? On that account, it is not truly established.‚Äù

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni mchis pa ma lags so zhes 'byung ba la yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtshan nyid kyi rgyu gang nas kyang ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni mchis pa ma lags so zhes 'byung ba la yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtshan nyid kyi rgyu gang nas kyang ma skyes pa ste /
translated: That which is not truly established is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, which is not produced from any characteristic cause.

original: de na yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de na yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If it does not exist,

original: rgyu nyid du brtags pa de las 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du brtags pa de las 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su brjod pa ste /
translated: then how could the nondual pristine consciousness that is the essence of the result be said to be produced from that which is imagined to be a cause?

original: ji ltar don dam par yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be truly established ultimately?

original: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing snga na yang de na yod pa ma yin du zin kyang /üîΩglo bur du byung bar rtog na 'o na ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam gyi dmigs pa dang / smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa yang skyes pa yin @60a * //
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs shing snga na yang de na yod pa ma yin du zin kyang / glo bur du byung bar rtog na 'o na ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam gyi dmigs pa dang / smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa yang skyes pa yin @60a * //
translated: Although it does not come from anywhere and did not exist before,

original: par ci ste mi brtag ste /
analyzed: par ci ste mi brtag ste /
translated: if it is imagined that it arises suddenly, then why would one not imagine that a gandharva city, a dream object, the water of a mirage, and so on are produced?

original: rigs pa mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a similar logic.

original: de lta na ni 'ga' yang phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur bas phyin ci log gi shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'ga' yang phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur bas phyin ci log gi shes pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then no one would be mistaken, and it would follow that there would be no mistaken consciousness.

original: 'ga' zhig phyin ci log nyid yin na ni rigs pa mthun pa'i phyir skyes pa thams cad kyang don dam par nor pa yin par rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig phyin ci log nyid yin na ni rigs pa mthun pa'i phyir skyes pa thams cad kyang don dam par nor pa yin par rtogs shing /
translated: If someone were mistaken, then because it would be logical, it would be understood that all beings are mistaken ultimately.

original: rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: An effect is that which follows after and occurs in dependence upon a cause.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed pa gang yin pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par byed pa gang yin pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin no //
translated: That which follows after and occurs in dependence upon a cause is the cause.

original: de skad du mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pas sgrub pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no zhes 'chad do zhe na /
analyzed: de skad du mngon sum dang / mi dmigs pas sgrub pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin no zhes 'chad do zhe na /
translated: Thus it explains that ‚Äúthe establishment of direct perception and nonapprehension is the state of affairs of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: tha snyad la ltos nas de skad du 'chad pa ni bden te /
analyzed: tha snyad la ltos nas de skad du 'chad pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that this is explained in dependence on conventional truth.

original: de nyid las 'di skad du /
analyzed: de nyid las 'di skad du /
translated: From that text:

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'di ni tha snyad pa yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'di ni tha snyad pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThis definition of valid knowledge is conventional.

original: 'di la yang gzhan dag log par rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la yang gzhan dag log par rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Others have misconceptions about this.

original: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis ni shes par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, neither positive nor negative concomitance is possible.

original: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by non-conceptual cognition,

original: de nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nges par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not determine.

original: rnam par rtog pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by conceptual cognition,

original: de la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no object.

original: rang gi ngo bo la phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin par zhen nas /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin par zhen nas /
translated: When one is attached to the external nature of one's own nature,

original: de na skyes pa med pa la der 'dzin pa de ni 'khrul pa kho na yin par zad do //
analyzed: de na skyes pa med pa la der 'dzin pa de ni 'khrul pa kho na yin par zad do //
translated: the apprehension of what is not produced there is just a mistake.

original: mi rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tshol ba la sogs pas kun nas blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ni don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mi rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tshol ba la sogs pas kun nas blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ni don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises after the experience of non-conceptual cognition, and the conceptual cognition that is motivated by searching, etc., are indeed without an object.

original: bye brag ci yang med do //
analyzed: bye brag ci yang med do //
translated: There is no difference.

original: don byed pa 'thob par mngon par zhen pa yang de dag nyid kyis lan btab po //
analyzed: don byed pa 'thob par mngon par zhen pa yang de dag nyid kyis lan btab po //
translated: The attachment to the attainment of the functioning of an object is also answered by those same arguments.

original: de ni tha snyad yin te mi dgag go //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad yin te mi dgag go //
translated: But that is conventional and is not refuted.

original: gzhan yang don byed pa 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang don byed pa 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin par yang mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, this performance of a function is seen to be a wrong consciousness.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' lding gi sngags mkhan la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' lding gi sngags mkhan la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, it is seen that a practitioner of the mantra of Garu·∏ça,

original: nam mkha' lding la sogs pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding la sogs pa bsgoms pas /
translated: having meditated on Garu·∏ça,

original: dug la sogs pa bsal ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa bsal ba yang mthong ste /
translated: removes poison, etc.

original: de na yang nam mkha' lding la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de na yang nam mkha' lding la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in that case, Garu·∏ça, etc. do not exist,

original: de'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entity of that is not apprehended.

original: gzhan yang med pa skyes nas skad cig tu ma lus par 'gags so zhes smras pa rnams kyis ni ma skyes pa yin yang smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa skyes nas skad cig tu ma lus par 'gags so zhes smras pa rnams kyis ni ma skyes pa yin yang smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes brjod par rigs te /
translated: Moreover, those who say that the nonexistent arises and ceases without remainder in an instant should say that although it does not arise, it appears like a mirage, etc.

original: 'di ltar thams @60b cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams @60b cad las thams cad skye bar thal ba la sogs pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of everything arising from everything else would ensue.

original: nus pa yang nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa yang nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, potency is not ascertained,

original: skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error is the same.

original: gzhan yang de dag thams cad ni brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag thams cad ni brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, all of these are mere words.

original: skye ba la dga' zhing skye ba la chags pa ni spangs dka' ba yin te /üîΩbstan bcos rnams dang 'jig rten pa'i //
analyzed: skye ba la dga' zhing skye ba la chags pa ni spangs dka' ba yin te / bstan bcos rnams dang 'jig rten pa'i //
translated: It is difficult to abandon delight in birth and attachment to birth.

original: dpe rnams pha yis bsgo na yang //
analyzed: dpe rnams pha yis bsgo na yang //
translated: Even though one is advised by the treatises and by worldly examples,

original: gnas pa med lam don zhen pa //
analyzed: gnas pa med lam don zhen pa //
translated: One who is attached to the meaning of the path of nonabiding

original: skyabs su 'ongs bzhin 'ga' spong med //
analyzed: skyabs su 'ongs bzhin 'ga' spong med //
translated: cannot abandon the slightest of the two.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don dam par yod par khas len pa ni skyon mang du yod de /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes don dam par yod par khas len pa ni skyon mang du yod de /
translated: There are many faults in accepting that nondual knowledge exists ultimately.

original: mu stegs can bzhin du phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de dag mkhyen na ni gzung 'dzin dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / don dam par yod pa mi mkhyen na ni mkhyen pa med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can bzhin du phyogs gcig pa'i stong pa nyid du smra bar 'gyur ba dang de bzhin gshegs pa mang po rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de dag mkhyen na ni gzung 'dzin dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / don dam par yod pa mi mkhyen na ni mkhyen pa med pa nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that it is emptiness of one part, like the tƒ´rthikas, and if the nondual knowledge of the many tathƒÅgatas knows that, it would have an apprehended object and an apprehending subject. If it does not know that which exists ultimately, it would be nonknowledge.

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin la yul du mi byed pa la ni skyon ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin la yul du mi byed pa la ni skyon ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault at all in not taking as an object what does not exist ultimately.

original: rmi lam na dmigs pa'i rta la sogs pa gnyid ma log pas ma mthong zhes te /
analyzed: rmi lam na dmigs pa'i rta la sogs pa gnyid ma log pas ma mthong zhes te /
translated: The horses, etc. that are perceived in a dream are not seen by one who is not asleep.

original: mi shes par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that they are not known.

original: shes pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang de lta bu yin na rung gi / de lta bu ma yin na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang de lta bu yin na rung gi / de lta bu ma yin na mi rung ngo //
translated: It is appropriate that the inconceivable object of knowledge be like that, but it is not appropriate that it not be like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchis pa ma lags te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchis pa ma lags te /
translated: For that very reason, it does not exist,

original: yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not exist as an object.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ji ltar 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: How could such a thing be destroyed?

original: 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be destroyed.

original: tshig de gsum gyis ni 'di 'dus ma byas nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de gsum gyis ni 'di 'dus ma byas nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: By these three statements, it is shown that it is unconditioned.

original: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste yin par sgrub par byed pa'i 'thad pa ni 'jig pa med pas sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan du zin kyang 'on kyang 'byung ba
analyzed: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste yin par sgrub par byed pa'i 'thad pa ni 'jig pa med pas sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan du zin kyang 'on kyang 'byung ba
translated: This is the proof that it is inconceivable. The proof is shown to be the non-existence of destruction.

original: med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa de dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa de dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: But the non-existence of origination and the non-existence of existence should also be seen.

original: 'jig pa med pa ni des rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa ni des rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the inconceivable is distinguished by that.

original: de dag gis 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of their unconditionedness,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: they are inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings nyid yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings nyid yin par bstan nas /
translated: Thus it is shown that the inconceivable and the realm of the self are the very realm of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the very realm of the Tathagata,üîΩit is said:

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i @61a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i @61a * //
translated: Thus, the Tathagata is inconceivable,

original: dbyings dang bdag gi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyings dang bdag gi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The realm and the realm of self, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Because things are empty in this way,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang bdag gi dbyings 'di gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang bdag gi dbyings 'di gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: they are inconceivable. Therefore, these two, the realm of the Tathagata and the realm of self, are not two.

original: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis shing /
translated: They are not divided into two.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang rnam par dben pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang rnam par dben pa nyid yin no //
translated: Both of these are just empty.

original: dbyings ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: dbyings ni rgyu ste /
translated: The realm is the cause.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni phyogs bcur btsal na dmigs su med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni phyogs bcur btsal na dmigs su med do //
translated: Thus, when one searches for the self in the ten directions, it is not found.

original: de bas na rin po che za ma tog las kyang rnam par dben pa 'di nyid sgo yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na rin po che za ma tog las kyang rnam par dben pa 'di nyid sgo yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, this very emptiness is the door to the jeweled casket.

original: rnam par dben pa de nyid sems la rgyun mi 'chad par gzhag na dngos por sgro 'dogs pa rnams chung ba dang shin tu chung bar 'gyur zhing yun ring du lon pa dang / dngos pos sgro 'dogs pa skabs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dben pa de nyid sems la rgyun mi 'chad par gzhag na dngos por sgro 'dogs pa rnams chung ba dang shin tu chung bar 'gyur zhing yun ring du lon pa dang / dngos pos sgro 'dogs pa skabs med pa'i phyir /
translated: If one continuously places the mind in this very emptiness, the superimpositions of entity will become less and less, and after a long time, the superimposition of entity will have no opportunity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings so //
translated: the realm of the Tathagata.

original: rnam par dben pa 'di sems la gzhag par nus sam /
analyzed: rnam par dben pa 'di sems la gzhag par nus sam /
translated: Is it possible to place this emptiness in the mind?

original: 'on te mi nus na /
analyzed: 'on te mi nus na /
translated: Or is it not possible?

original: ci'i phyir de skad du smras she na /üîΩsems nyid de rnam pa can la de skad du bstan te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad du smras she na / sems nyid de rnam pa can la de skad du bstan te /
translated: Why is it said in that way?üîΩThe mind itself is endowed with that aspect, and it is taught in that way.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
translated: The nature of that is the Tathagata.

original: des na bdag dang de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dbyings tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: des na bdag dang de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis dbyings tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the self and the Tathagata are not different realms.

original: ngo bo nyid bstan zin to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bstan zin to //
translated: The essence has been taught.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa'i ched du re zhig snga phyi mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa'i ched du re zhig snga phyi mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the wisdom of the Tathagata, first, in order to connect the previous and following,

original: tha dad pa med pa nyid du ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin no zhes bka' stsal pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa nyid du ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin no zhes bka' stsal pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is taught that there is no difference: The Bhagavat said, Cultivating the self is cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin no zhes 'di dang gzhan du gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyu'i bdag nyid de bsgom pa'i sgras bdag bsgom pa yin par bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yin no zhes 'di dang gzhan du gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyu'i bdag nyid de bsgom pa'i sgras bdag bsgom pa yin par bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: The statement cultivating the self is cultivating the perfection of wisdom in this and other places means that the perfection of wisdom is the essence of the cause. The word cultivating indicates that it is the cultivation of the self. This is the meaning.

original: // de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: // de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'di ltar bdag rnam par dben pa 'di tshig bla dags lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'di ltar bdag rnam par dben pa 'di tshig bla dags lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Bhagavan, this so-called perfection of wisdom is a designation for the self's isolation.

original: de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag gi dbyings 'tshal ba des chags pa ma mchis pa 'tshal ba lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag gi dbyings 'tshal ba des chags pa ma mchis pa 'tshal ba lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Bhagavan, whoever knows the realm of the self knows non-attachment.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i bdag gi dbyings 'tshal ba de ni chags pa ma @61b mchis pa 'chal ba lags te /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i bdag gi dbyings 'tshal ba de ni chags pa ma @61b mchis pa 'chal ba lags te /
translated: Whoever knows the realm of the self as it has been taught knows non-attachment.

original: dmigs par sgro 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs par sgro 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa la chags pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of non-attachment to the obscuration that reifies objects,

original: chags pa ma mchis pa'i tshe mkhyen pa can nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa'i tshe mkhyen pa can nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: when there is no attachment, omniscience is the Tathagata himself.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gang gis chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gang gis chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúWhoever knows non-attachment does not know any dharma at all.‚Äù

original: shes bya la chags na ni chags med nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya la chags na ni chags med nyams pa yin no //
translated: If one is attached to the knowable, one loses non-attachment.

original: chos gang yang med pa de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: chos gang yang med pa de nyid kyang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is there no dharma at all?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThus, inconceivable wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir la sems pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir la sems pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the obscuration of reification is abandoned, and because thought has the nature of reification.

original: dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the obscuration of objectification is abandoned,

original: chos gang la yang shes pa med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nyid lags te /
analyzed: chos gang la yang shes pa med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes nyid lags te /
translated: the absence of knowledge of any dharma is the wisdom of the Buddha himself.

original: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i chos can bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i chos can bstan to //
translated: He has taught the Dharma that is free of attachment.

original: chags pa med pa ston pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: chags pa med pa ston pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de ji ltar 'thad /
translated: How could it be tenable to say that the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata does not apprehend the teaching of nonattachment?

original: gang gi phyir don 'di rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don 'di rigs par 'gyur /
translated: For what reason would this be tenable?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The point of ‚Äúwhy is that?‚Äù is as follows.

original: gal te bsam pa cung zad kyang ma mchis shing mi mkhyen na /
analyzed: gal te bsam pa cung zad kyang ma mchis shing mi mkhyen na /
translated: If he has no thoughts at all and does not know,

original: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could he turn the wheel of Dharma?

original: ma bsams par ni bsam pa dang / dbang po dang 'don pa dag ma shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bsams par ni bsam pa dang / dbang po dang 'don pa dag ma shes pa'i phyir /
translated: For it is not tenable to turn the wheel of Dharma without thinking, without knowing the thoughts, faculties, and inclinations of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be tenable to turn the wheel of Dharma?

original: lan du ye shes de ni don dam par mchis pa ma lags te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du ye shes de ni don dam par mchis pa ma lags te zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response, it is said, ‚ÄúThat wisdom does not exist ultimately.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ye shes de ni don dam par de kho na nyid du ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis na mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ye shes de ni don dam par de kho na nyid du ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis na mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: For that wisdom does not exist ultimately in reality in the way that it has been described.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since such an essence does not exist, how can the wheel of the Dharma be turned?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni spong ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù means ‚Äúnot at all.‚Äù

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni mtshon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni mtshon pa yin gyi /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is an illustration;

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad kyang mdzad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is that all the deeds of a Buddha are also without activity.

original: 'on kyang sngon yongs su sbyangs pa'i bye brag gi phyir dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyi phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku'i dbang gis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon yongs su sbyangs pa'i bye brag gi phyir dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyi phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku'i dbang gis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye'o //
translated: Nevertheless, because of the specific previous training, because of the power of the vow, and because of the power of the Dharma body of the TathƒÅgata, the consciousness that appears to have the aspect of turning the wheel of the Dharma arises for those who are ready.

original: de skad @62a * //
analyzed: de skad @62a * //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa las /
analyzed: du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bstan pa las /
translated: In the Teaching of the Secrets of the TathƒÅgata,

original: ji ltar 'khrul 'khor byas rgyud las //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul 'khor byas rgyud las //
translated: Just as from a mechanism made by a magician

original: rlung gis bskyod de sgra dag 'byung //
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod de sgra dag 'byung //
translated: Sounds come forth, though there is no real agent,

original: sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis ni //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa'i dbang gis ni //
translated: So also the world with its many kinds of beingsüîΩArises from the power of action.

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas chos kyang ston //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas chos kyang ston // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, the Buddha teaches the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa byams pa mgon pos kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa mgon pos kyang //
translated: The noble Maitreya, the Lord, also says:

original: rtsol ba med cing chags dang bral //
analyzed: rtsol ba med cing chags dang bral //
translated: Without effort, free from attachment,

original: thogs pa med par rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thogs pa med par rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: always present, without obstruction,

original: dris pa thams cad sel mkhyen pa //
analyzed: dris pa thams cad sel mkhyen pa //
translated: knowing how to remove all doubts,

original: smon lam mkhyen par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: smon lam mkhyen par 'dod pa yin //
translated: he is known as the one with the knowledge of prayer.

original: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur na //
translated: When the cause is fully ripened,

original: gang gang tshe na gang dag la //
analyzed: gang gang tshe na gang dag la //
translated: at whatever time,

original: phan par bya ba 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: phan par bya ba 'byung ba ni //
translated: whatever benefits ariseüîΩfor whomever,

original: de dang de la de 'phel 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dang de la de 'phel 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: that increases for him.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de don dam par ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba la chags pa ni bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de don dam par ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba la chags pa ni bzhed pa'o //
translated: When that wisdom does not exist ultimately, then that wisdom is said to be without attachment. Attachment is desire.

original: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas chags pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas chags pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: That does not exist for him, so it is without attachment.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: When that wisdom is without attachment, then that wisdom is said to be insubstantial.

original: dngos po ni byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Entity refers to an occurrence.

original: dngos po med pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Non-entity is not like that.

original: 'dus ma byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is unconditioned, that is the meaning.

original: gang 'byung ba de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel zhing chags pa yin la /
analyzed: gang 'byung ba de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel zhing chags pa yin la /
translated: That which occurs is certainly connected with cause and effect.

original: gang chags pa med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te de bas na dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang chags pa med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin te de bas na dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is not connected is unconditioned. Therefore, it is said to be a non-entity.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rkyen ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rkyen ni bzhi ste /
translated: The conditions of mind and mental factors are four:

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po dang de ma thag pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po dang de ma thag pa dang / rgyu zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: object, dominant, immediately preceding, and cause.

original: de dag ni dngos po med pa la mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po med pa la mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that these are not tenable in regard to a non-entity,

original: ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThat wisdom is not an object.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object such as form, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la dbang byed pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la mi gnas pas na ye shes ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bskyed pa la dbang byed pa'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la mi gnas pas na ye shes ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it does not abide in the sense faculties such as the eyes that control the generation of consciousness, that wisdom does not abide.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent,

original: ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThat wisdom is without support.‚Äù

original: brten pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: brten pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Support is seeing.

original: de ni skye bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: de ni skye bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa rnams la /
translated: It is the future that is being generated, that is approaching generation.

original: go 'byed pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: go 'byed pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the granting of opportunity.

original: gang gis go phye bas 'bras bu brten par 'gyur ba de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis go phye bas 'bras bu brten par 'gyur ba de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no support that is the result of the granting of opportunity,

original: @62b brten pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: @62b brten pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: it is without support.üîΩThat wisdom is not generated.

original: ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de dag gis ni skye bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de dag gis ni skye bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The homogeneous, omnipresent, and ripening causes generate the future that is being generated, that is approaching generation.

original: de 'gog par byed pa ni ma bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'gog par byed pa ni ma bskyed pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of that is non-production.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to co-existent and associated causes,

original: ma thob pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ma thob pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúnon-attainment.‚Äù

original: 'gag bzhin pa dang da ltar byung ba 'gag pa la /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa dang da ltar byung ba 'gag pa la /
translated: With regard to that which is in the process of cessation and that which has arisen and is in the process of cessation,

original: mngon du phyogs pa dag la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu de gnyis kyis 'bras bu thob par byed pa yin na de med pa'i phyir ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa dag la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu de gnyis kyis 'bras bu thob par byed pa yin na de med pa'i phyir ma thob pa'o //
translated: if the two causes‚Äîco-existent and associated‚Äîcause the attainment of a result, then because they do not exist, there is non-attainment.

original: byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: byed rgyu ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The active cause is the dominant condition.

original: de yang 'dis byas kyi dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: de yang 'dis byas kyi dngos po thams cad do //
translated: And that is all things, which are made by this.

original: 'dus byed pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du byed pas rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byed pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du byed pas rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: Since the active cause acts in all circumstances, it is of many types.
