original: de la rten du gyur pa rnams ni ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba der bstan zin to//
analyzed: de la rten du gyur pa rnams ni ye shes de ni brten pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba der bstan zin to//
translated: With regard to that, those that are the basis have already been explained in the statement, ‚ÄúThat wisdom is without a basis.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang du byas nas skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang du byas nas skye bar yang mi 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: With regard to those other than that, it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not arise.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgras ni ma skyes pa dang mi skye ba yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni ma skyes pa dang mi skye ba yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be seen as referring to the unborn and the non-arisen.

original: de yang gtan tshigs gang gis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs gang gis mngon zhe na /
translated: And by what reasoning is that evident?

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs su ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs su ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is stated: ‚ÄúThat wisdom is not conditioned by qualities, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa ma lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis pa ma lags te /
translated: Thus, that wisdom is not conditioned by qualities,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ma bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis ma bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: because it is not accomplished by the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa ma lags zhes bya ba ni yon tan las gzhan pa rnams kyis sgrib par mi byed pa'i tshul gyis 'dus byas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa ma lags zhes bya ba ni yon tan las gzhan pa rnams kyis sgrib par mi byed pa'i tshul gyis 'dus byas ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not conditioned by non-qualities, meaning it is not conditioned by those other than qualities, in the sense that they do not obscure it.

original: yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa gnyis kyis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa gnyis kyis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
translated: All conditioned phenomena are included in both qualities and non-qualities.

original: 'di gnyis phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis phan tshun spangs te /
translated: These two are mutually exclusive,

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the characteristic of being mutually exclusive.

original: gal te yon tan dang / yon tan ma yin pa gnyis kyis 'dus ma byas pa yin na 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi ye shes thun mong ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te yon tan dang / yon tan ma yin pa gnyis kyis 'dus ma byas pa yin na 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi ye shes thun mong ma yin pa yin la /
translated: If it is unconditioned by both qualities and non-qualities, then how is it the uncommon pristine consciousness of the TathƒÅgata?

original: gang zag gzhan gyi ma yin /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyi ma yin /
translated: Why is it not the uncommon pristine consciousness of other persons?

original: 'dus ma byas pa rgyu dang ma 'brel ba la mi ltos pa dag ci'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa yin snyam pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa rgyu dang ma 'brel ba la mi ltos pa dag ci'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa yin snyam pa de'i phyir /
translated: Why is it uncommon if the unconditioned does not depend on a cause that is not related?

original: ci'i slad du zhe na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhe na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir lan ni 'di ltar ye shes @63a * //üîΩde ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni 'di ltar ye shes @63a * // de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reply here is as follows: That pristine consciousnessüîΩis inconceivable.

original: 'di bsam pa dang bral bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bsam pa dang bral bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Since this is free from thought, it is inconceivable.

original: bsam pa sgro btags pa dang bral ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa sgro btags pa dang bral ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the freedom from the superimposition of thought,

original: des na yon tan nam yon tan ma lags pas kyang ji skad du bstan par bgyi'o zhes gsungs te /üîΩgtan tshigs des sam /
analyzed: des na yon tan nam yon tan ma lags pas kyang ji skad du bstan par bgyi'o zhes gsungs te / gtan tshigs des sam /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is also taught as a quality or a non-quality.‚ÄùüîΩThat is the reason.

original: ye shes des yon tan nam /
analyzed: ye shes des yon tan nam /
translated: That pristine consciousness is a quality or

original: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus byas nyid du ji ltar bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus byas nyid du ji ltar bstan par bgyi /
translated: How can it be shown to be conditioned by something that is not a quality?

original: gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med pa yin na /
translated: If that wisdom is said to be inconceivable because it is not an object of apprehension,

original: gzhan ci zhig bsam du yod ces bya ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan ci zhig bsam du yod ces bya ba ma yin no ;
translated: then what else is there to conceive?üîΩWhy is that wisdom inconceivable?

original: / de ci'i slad du ye shes de bsam du ma mchis pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gtong ste /üîΩ'dzin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ci'i slad du ye shes de bsam du ma mchis pa ste zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gtong ste / 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is because it is not an object of apprehension.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du ye shes de ni bsam par bya ba dang / sems par byed pa las dben zhing de gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du ye shes de ni bsam par bya ba dang / sems par byed pa las dben zhing de gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: This shows that that wisdom is isolated from what is to be conceived and the conceiver, and that it is not a superimposition of those two.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude,

original: gang de ltar shes pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang de ltar shes pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúOne who knows it in that way‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags par 'tshal lo //
translated: The wisdom of the Buddha is to be understood as the consciousness that is isolated from the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, in the manner of non-observation as previously explained.

original: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is inconceivable in this way,

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa bsal nas 'bras bu nyid kyang bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa bsal nas 'bras bu nyid kyang bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: having eliminated the connection with a cause, the result itself is also eliminated.

original: ye shes de ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
analyzed: ye shes de ni chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
translated: That wisdom is not the perfect enlightenment of any phenomenon,

original: mkhyen pa ma mchis so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa ma mchis so zhes gsungs te /
translated: nor is it knowledge.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pas /
translated: Because it is utterly pure,

original: rnam pa thams cad khong du chud pa'i mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad khong du chud pa'i mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
translated: it is not the perfect enlightenment that comprehends all aspects,

original: de las gzhan pa'i mkhyen pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mkhyen pa ma mchis te /
translated: nor is it any other kind of knowledge.

original: yul gyi stobs las byung zhing /
analyzed: yul gyi stobs las byung zhing /
translated: It does not arise by the power of an object,

original: yul la shes pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin pa de ji ltar shes par byed /
analyzed: yul la shes pa gang yin pa de lta bu ma yin pa de ji ltar shes par byed /
translated: nor is it a consciousness that is aware of an object. How can it be known?

original: 'dis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like eliminating the result of conscious effort.

original: ye shes de ni sngon gyi mtha' 'am /
analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon gyi mtha' 'am /
translated: That wisdom does not come from the pastüîΩor from the future.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mchis pa ma lags so zhes bya bas ni bdag po'i 'bras bu bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mchis pa ma lags so zhes bya bas ni bdag po'i 'bras bu bsal ba yin te /
translated: This eliminates the dominant result,

original: de ni dus nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no fixed time.üîΩThat wisdom is not something that has not arisen before

original: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni ye shes gang gi rgyu sngon skyes pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni ye shes gang gi rgyu sngon skyes pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: refers to that wisdom which has not arisen before as a cause.

original: sngon gyi sgras rgyu'i @63b don la bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sgras rgyu'i @63b don la bya ste /
translated: The word before refers to the meaning of cause,

original: dper na sngon bzhin dang / phyi ma bzhin dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du song ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon bzhin dang / phyi ma bzhin dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du song ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as in the expressions like before, after, and preceded by correct knowledge.

original: 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba yin te /
translated: This eliminates the result of karmic maturation,

original: 'das ba las de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das ba las de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established from the past.üîΩThat wisdom is not something that has not arisen before

original: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i zla dgag pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags te zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i zla dgag pa bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the negation of the former.

original: thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid ston pa gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa can nyid ston pa gtso bo yin no //
translated: It primarily teaches that everything is without a cause.

original: 'di gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis dngos po thams cad bsdus te /
translated: These two include all things.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive and do not coexist.

original: phung po gsum pa bzhin med do //
analyzed: phung po gsum pa bzhin med do //
translated: There is no third alternative.

original: 'bras bu gsum nyid mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma skyes pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsum nyid mi 'thad pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma skyes pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reason why the three fruits are untenable is because they are not produced.

original: ye shes skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: That which is produced by knowledge is a fruit, not anything else.

original: de las gzhan pa 'dus byas kyi chos 'gag pa sel bar byed pa ni gang ma skyes pa de ni nub par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'dus byas kyi chos 'gag pa sel bar byed pa ni gang ma skyes pa de ni nub par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: That which is other than that, the conditioned dharma that is the cessation of that, is not produced, does not set,

original: chad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and does not perish.

original: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang gnyis su byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang gnyis su byis pa rnams kyis brtags so //
translated: The destruction of things is imagined by the childish in two ways: with remainder and without remainder.

original: de la lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas nub par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas nub par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
translated: With regard to that, it is said that it does not set in the sense of having remainder.

original: gnas skabs su nub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs su nub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not set in the present.

original: chad par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yong ye lhag ma med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chad par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yong ye lhag ma med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not annihilated‚Äù means it is not completely nonexistent.

original: rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'gog par byed pa ni ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gang yang ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'gog par byed pa ni ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gang yang ma mchis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a result that is in accordance with a cause‚Äù means that there is no other wisdom that is similar to that wisdom.

original: ye shes de las gzhan pa'i ye shes 'dra zhing mthun pa gang yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: ye shes de las gzhan pa'i ye shes 'dra zhing mthun pa gang yang ma mchis na /
translated: If there is no other wisdom that is similar to that wisdom,

original: rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin par gang zhig 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin par gang zhig 'gyur te ;
translated: then what would be a result that is in accordance with a cause?

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba yin na ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba yin na ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin par bzhed do //
translated: If it were similar to a cause, it would be a result that is in accordance with a cause.üîΩBecause there is no entity that is similar to that, all dharmas are not born.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po ma mchis pa de'i slad du chos thams cad ye shes 'di yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po ma mchis pa de'i slad du chos thams cad ye shes 'di yang ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that wisdom is not born,

original: ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par bzhed cing 'dra ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par bzhed cing 'dra ba ma mchis te /
translated: it is accepted as inconceivable wisdom.

original: 'di la 'dra zhing mthun pa yod pa ma yin pas rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'dra zhing mthun pa yod pa ma yin pas rgyu dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Because there is nothing that is similar to it, it is not a result that is in accordance with a cause.

original: 'on kyang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba'i snga rol du ci'i phyir 'gag pa sel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bsal ba'i snga rol du ci'i phyir 'gag pa sel bar byed ce na /
translated: But why does one eliminate cessation prior to eliminating the result that resembles its cause?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gsum char gyis kyang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa yin la de'i @64a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos gsum char gyis kyang rgyu mthun pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa yin la de'i @64a * //
translated: Because all three types of phenomena‚Äîvirtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral‚Äîdeposit the latent tendencies that resemble their causes.

original: 'bras bus kyang de 'jog par byed pas /
analyzed: 'bras bus kyang de 'jog par byed pas /
translated: And since their results also deposit those latent tendencies,

original: mi mthun pa nye bar gyur pa las gzhan du 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa nye bar gyur pa las gzhan du 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the continuum of results does not cease from one moment to the next, except when adverse conditions occur.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin zhing lung du bstan pa las byung ba yin pas /üîΩrnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pas rgyun chad pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin zhing lung du bstan pa las byung ba yin pas / rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pas rgyun chad pa yin te /
translated: The ripened result is not neutral and arises from a virtuous or nonvirtuous cause.üîΩTherefore, since it deposits the latent tendencies of karmic maturation, it is interrupted.

original: des na de nyid du dgag pa srid pas na 'gag pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid du dgag pa srid pas na 'gag pa sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Since it is possible to stop that result, one eliminates cessation.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni thog ma dang / dbus ma dang / tha ma mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni thog ma dang / dbus ma dang / tha ma mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The beginning, middle, and end are not apprehended.

original: thog ma ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: thog ma ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The beginning is the impure stage.

original: dbus ni ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dbus ni ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The middle is the impure-pure stage.

original: tha ma ni dag pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: tha ma ni dag pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The end is the pure stage.

original: de dag ma skyes pas ni mi dmigs pa thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pas ni mi dmigs pa thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Since those are not produced, they are not apprehended. Because the beginning, middle, and end are not apprehended, that wisdom is like space.

original: 'dir yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to teach the application of non-apprehension,

original: ye shes de la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes de la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said that equality or inequality is not apprehended in that wisdom.

original: ye shes 'di nam mkha' dang mnyam pas mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'di nam mkha' dang mnyam pas mnyam pa'o //
translated: This wisdom is equal because it is equal to space.

original: de las gzhan pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is unequal because it is not the same as anything else.

original: 'di la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Equality or inequality is not apprehended in that.

original: yang na ye shes de mnyam pa ni mnyam pa nyid dam mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes de mnyam pa ni mnyam pa nyid dam mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: Or else, that wisdom is equal, i.e., the same, as the unequal, i.e., the unequalled.

original: mi mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs te mi rig go //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs te mi rig go //
translated: It is not observed, i.e., it is not known.

original: gnyi ga mi dmigs pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni mi mnyam pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga mi dmigs pa de'i slad du ye shes de ni mi mnyam pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Because both are not observed, that wisdom is equal to the unequal, because it is equal to the unequalled space.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las /
translated: In the Bodhisattva Canon,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshig de skad du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshig de skad du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the Lord has explained the term ‚Äúequal to the unequal‚Äù in that way.

original: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab cing chags pa med pa'i ye shes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab cing chags pa med pa'i ye shes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, after teaching the inconceivable, nonattached wisdom,

original: de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kha cig gis brtags pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kha cig gis brtags pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to remove the imputation of some pure mundane wisdom that is subsequent to that,

original: ye shes de la ni de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'di'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: ye shes de la ni de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúin that wisdom, no other wisdom like it is observed.‚ÄùüîΩIts aspect is like that.

original: de dang tshul 'dra ba ni de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de dang tshul 'dra ba ni de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: That which is similar to it is like it.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: It is the subsequent action.

original: 'di la de yod pa ma yin pas de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di la de yod pa ma yin pas de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
translated: Since it does not exist here, no other knowledge like it is perceived,

original: don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro @64b zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro @64b zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: because ultimately all things are unarisen.

original: kun rdzob tu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa la sogs pa las /
translated: Even conventionally, in the teaching of the inconceivable secret of the Tathagata,

original: 'di bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: this is refuted.

original: 'dis ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is always in meditative equipoise.

original: yang na de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, ‚Äúno other knowledge like it‚Äù

original: 'di rang gi ngo bo dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo la bya ste mi mthun par gleng ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rang gi ngo bo dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bo la bya ste mi mthun par gleng ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that it is not a nature that is incompatible with its own nature, because it is not incompatible.

original: de skad du mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i skabs su gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i skabs su gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the context of the four fearlessnesses.

original: de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that does not exist,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs so //
translated: no other knowledge like it is perceived.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that,

original: 'jam dpal ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam zhes dris so /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam zhes dris so /
translated: it is asked, ‚ÄúManjusri, is this knowledge not unchanging?‚Äù

original: // / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / bam po drug pa /
translated: Chapter 6üîΩ

original: mi bsgyur ba 'di ji lta bu yin zhe na /üîΩphyir rgol bar byed pas 'khrugs pa'am /
analyzed: mi bsgyur ba 'di ji lta bu yin zhe na / phyir rgol bar byed pas 'khrugs pa'am /
translated: What is the action of not being turned back?üîΩOne is turned back by being disturbed by an adversary,

original: g-yos pa ni bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: g-yos pa ni bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: or by being moved.

original: de lta bu ma yin pas mi bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pas mi bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: Since the Buddha is not like that, he is not turned back.

original: ji lta zhe na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur te /
translated: How is that? He has become a perfect Buddha.üîΩWhen he had destroyed the defilements, he declared:

original: zag pa zad pa na 'di dag ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa na 'di dag ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: These are the dharmas that are obstacles,

original: 'di dag ni nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nges par 'byin pa'i lam yin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa na /
translated: and this is the path that leads to deliverance.

original: nga la phyir rgol ba'i mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
analyzed: nga la phyir rgol ba'i mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas /
translated: Since he did not see any sign of an adversary,

original: mi bde ba dang bag tsha ba med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob ste bzhugs /
analyzed: mi bde ba dang bag tsha ba med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob ste bzhugs /
translated: he remained without distress or fear,

original: khyu mchog gi gnas yin par zhal gyis bzhes /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas yin par zhal gyis bzhes /
translated: and he declared that he had attained the state of the bull.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs /
translated: He roared the lion‚Äôs roar in the assembly.üîΩHe set rolling the wheel of the Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi bsgyur ba'i las yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi bsgyur ba'i las yin no //
translated: These are the actions of not being turned back.

original: mi bsgyur ba 'di yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi bsgyur ba 'di yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not transformed?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ye shes de ni ma bgyis pa de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ye shes de ni ma bgyis pa de zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúThat knowledge is not made.‚Äù

original: ma bgyis pa nyid lags pa de'i slad du mngon par bzhed pa'i ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba lags so //üîΩgzhan dag mi bsgyur bar byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bgyis pa nyid lags pa de'i slad du mngon par bzhed pa'i ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba lags so // gzhan dag mi bsgyur bar byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not made, this knowledge that is desired is not transformed.

original: mi bsgyur ba yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mi bsgyur ba yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Others are established as not transformed because they are free from the activity of transformation.

original: ye shes 'di la ni bsgyur ba dang / mi bsgyur ba'i tha snyad 'jug pa yang med pas shin tu yang bsgyur ba med do zhes dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes 'di la ni bsgyur ba dang / mi bsgyur ba'i tha snyad 'jug pa yang med pas shin tu yang bsgyur ba med do zhes dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But this knowledge is not even transformed, because the conventions of transformation and non-transformation do not apply to it.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that by means of an example, he said,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavat, it is like this:

original: dper na / k'arsha pa na rtags ma btab pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na / k'arsha pa na rtags ma btab pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, an unstamped kar·π£apa·πáa coin.‚Äù

original: rtags btab pa ni zong du bya ba'i rtags btab pa ste /
analyzed: rtags btab pa ni zong du bya ba'i rtags btab pa ste /
translated: A stamped coin is one that has been stamped with a mark for sale.

original: dper na 'dra ma ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dra ma ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a cowrie shell, etc.

original: 'di de lta bu ma yin pas @65a * //
analyzed: 'di de lta bu ma yin pas @65a * //
translated: This is not like that, so

original: rtags ma btab pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ma btab pa'o //
translated: it is unstamped.

original: 'di bsgyur ba yang ma lags pa ni rtags ma btab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsgyur ba las gzhan pa dbyig la sogs pa mi bsgyur ba'i ngo bo yang ma lags te /
analyzed: 'di bsgyur ba yang ma lags pa ni rtags ma btab pa'i phyir ro // bsgyur ba las gzhan pa dbyig la sogs pa mi bsgyur ba'i ngo bo yang ma lags te /
translated: It is not a transformation because it is not marked.üîΩIt is not a non-transformation, such as gold, etc., because it is not of that nature.

original: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a non-transformation because it is not of that nature.

original: de bas na de gnyi ga ma lags pa'i grangs su mchi'o //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyi ga ma lags pa'i grangs su mchi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is counted as neither of the two.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, in the same way, etc. applies the meaning.

original: gang ma byas pa de ni bsgyur ba dang / mi bsgyur ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang ma byas pa de ni bsgyur ba dang / mi bsgyur ba'i gnas ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is not made is not a basis for transformation or non-transformation.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes bshad zin to //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes bshad zin to //
translated: The knowledge without attachment has been explained.

original: da ni snod du gyur pa'i gang zag rnams bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni snod du gyur pa'i gang zag rnams bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, the persons who are vessels should be taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa /
translated: The explanation of the TathƒÅgata's knowledge.

original: 'di ltar zab mo bstan pa la ni de kho na ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar zab mo bstan pa la ni de kho na ma yin gyi /
translated: In this way, in the explanation of the profound, it is not that reality.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin cing lhag par smos pa'i gang zag de dag su zhe na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can dag las gzhan pa dag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin cing lhag par smos pa'i gang zag de dag su zhe na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can dag las gzhan pa dag ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are not other than those who possess the lineage of the Tathagata,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Lord declares, ‚ÄúThose who are not subject to the phenomena of samsara, etc.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba'i chos can de dag ni rigs med cing de las yid byung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos can de dag ni rigs med cing de las yid byung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: They are not subject to the phenomena of samsara because they are not devoid of the lineage and they do not turn away from it.

original: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin pa yin no //
translated: They are of the nature of samsara.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can te /
translated: Those who are subject to the phenomena of nirvana are those who possess the lineage of the sravaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: 'khor bas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor bas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are afraid of samsara.

original: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga ma yin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can te /
translated: Those who are not subject to either are those who possess the bodhisattva lineage.

original: de yang rigs la gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs la gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, they are only those who abide in the lineage.

original: de'i phyir de dag 'dir mos par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'dir mos par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they are devoted to this.

original: gang dag 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúthose who do not transcend the perishing aggregates‚Äù is as follows.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni skyon yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni skyon yin te /
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates is a fault.

original: de las bskyod nas stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir /üîΩlta bas byas pa rnams zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang dag 'jig tshogs las 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: de las bskyod nas stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir / lta bas byas pa rnams zad pa dang gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bsam pas gang dag 'jig tshogs las 'da' bar byed do //
translated: Because one transcends it and abides in emptiness,üîΩone exhausts and transcends the views.

original: gang dag de lta bu ma yin pa de dag chos thams cad skye ba med par mos pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs las ma bskyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de lta bu ma yin pa de dag chos thams cad skye ba med par mos pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs las ma bskyod pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not transcend the perishing aggregates in this way are not shaken from the view of the perishing aggregates because they are devoted to the non-arising of all things.

original: gang dag 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ma bas pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la @65b lhag par mos pa kho na yin par dgongs pa ste /üîΩde dag mos par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang ma bas pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa la @65b lhag par mos pa kho na yin par dgongs pa ste / de dag mos par 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Those who are not free from attachment, hatred, and delusion are devoted to the non-arising of all things.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag kho na lhag par mos pa dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag kho na lhag par mos pa dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that only those who belong to the bodhisattva family are devoted.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag la legs par khong du chud pa ci zhig yod na /üîΩgang gis de dag kho na lhag par mos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de dag la legs par khong du chud pa ci zhig yod na / gang gis de dag kho na lhag par mos pa yin gyi /
translated: What is the understanding of those who have a special belief in just those?

original: gzhan ma yin no zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that they alone have a special belief, and not others?

original: de'i phyir mi bas pa ni bas par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi bas pa ni bas par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the inexhaustible is not exhausted, etc.

original: bas pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa'o //üîΩde med pa ni mi bas pa ste /
analyzed: bas pa zhes bya ba ni zhig pa'o // de med pa ni mi bas pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Exhausted‚Äù means destroyed.üîΩ‚Äú Inexhaustible‚Äù means not exhausted.

original: 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as unconditioned.

original: bas pa yang lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: bas pa yang lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Exhausted‚Äù also means with remainder,

original: dper na grangs can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grangs can rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: like the view of the Samkhyas.

original: yongs su bas pa ni thams cad du lhag ma med par zad pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su bas pa ni thams cad du lhag ma med par zad pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Completely exhausted‚Äù means completely exhausted without remainder,

original: dper na mdo sde pa'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mdo sde pa'i lta bu ste /
translated: like the view of the Sautrantikas.

original: de bas na de dag ni log par mos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni log par mos pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they have a false belief,

original: 'di la lhag par mos pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la lhag par mos pa med do //
translated: but they do not have a special belief in this.

original: gang dag de lta bu'i lta ba can ma yin pa de dag mos par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gang dag de lta bu'i lta ba can ma yin pa de dag mos par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Those who do not have such a view will have a special belief.

original: / gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba rnams ma skyes par lhag par mos pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba rnams ma skyes par lhag par mos pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who do not transcend cyclic existence means that they are not born in cyclic existence, because they are intent on the non-arising of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i rmongs pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi'o zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i rmongs pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not counted as being in cyclic existence means that they are not defiled, because they have abandoned the delusion of clinging to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: nyon mongs skye ba nyon mongs min //
analyzed: nyon mongs skye ba nyon mongs min //
translated: Afflictions arise, but they are not afflictions,

original: skyon med yon tan dpag med ldan //üîΩzhes bstan to //
analyzed: skyon med yon tan dpag med ldan // zhes bstan to //
translated: free from faults, endowed with immeasurable virtues.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the one who is established on the path of seeing.

original: gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rtag tu bar chad med pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rtag tu bar chad med pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not without the path means that tranquility and insight always arise without interruption.

original: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa rtogs pa shin tu cher gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa rtogs pa shin tu cher gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not have the notion of a path means that the realization of non-arising becomes very great.

original: 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the one who is situated on the path of cultivation.

original: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su gnang ba mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su gnang ba mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, excellent, excellent! and so on is the permission.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na /
translated: In the absence of the Bhagavatƒ´, that is, when the Bhagavatƒ´ has passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: gang la la dag byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag rigs pa rnam pa bzhis gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rgyud la tshul rnam pa drug po 'dis
analyzed: gang la la dag byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag rigs pa rnam pa bzhis gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rgyud la tshul rnam pa drug po 'dis
translated: those who are connected with the objects of the factors of enlightenment, such as ordinary beings, and the wholesome and unwholesome dharmas, in order to tame them with the four reasonings, this system of six modes

original: phyin par byed pas 'dul @66a * //
analyzed: phyin par byed pas 'dul @66a * //
translated: is the taming.

original: ba yin la de nyid mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab mo yin te /
analyzed: ba yin la de nyid mtha' gnyis su lhung ba rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab mo yin te /
translated: And that itself is profound because it is difficult for those who have fallen into the two extremes to understand.

original: bstan ma thag pa 'di dang thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi phyogs kyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa 'di dang thugs su chud pa'i ngo bo byang chub kyi phyogs kyi bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa ste /
translated: This is the very essence of the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of wisdom which is the essence of the factors of enlightenment, and it has just been taught.

original: nyan 'dod pa dang mos pa ste thos nas sems dang bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'di de lta bu yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa dang / kun 'tshal ba ste /
analyzed: nyan 'dod pa dang mos pa ste thos nas sems dang bar gyur pa nyid kyis 'di de lta bu yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed pa dang / kun 'tshal ba ste /
translated: Those who listen to it, who desire to listen to it, who aspire to it, who, having heard it, are delighted by it, and who, by means of that delight, ascertain it, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is like this, not otherwise,‚Äù

original: thos shing mos nas rigs pas sems shing gtan la 'bebs par byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas bsgoms pas khong du chud par byed pa mchis sam /
analyzed: thos shing mos nas rigs pas sems shing gtan la 'bebs par byed pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ste ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas bsgoms pas khong du chud par byed pa mchis sam /
translated: who understand it, who, having heard it and aspired to it, reflect on it with reasoning and come to a conclusion, and who fully grasp it, who, having understood it as it is, internalize it through meditation‚Äî

original: lan ni 'od srungs 'khor 'di nyid na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan ni 'od srungs 'khor 'di nyid na'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, in this very retinue‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'jam dpal gyis kyang byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir 'di nyid na'ang zhes bya bas ni nges par 'dzin pa smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis kyang byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir 'di nyid na'ang zhes bya bas ni nges par 'dzin pa smras pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this very retinue‚Äù indicates ascertainment, because Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ also blessed it.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas rjes su gzung ba dang bral ba'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas rjes su gzung ba dang bral ba'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the domain of those who are not accepted by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag kho na zhugs pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag kho na zhugs pa yin par bstan te /
translated: This shows that only those who have the Bodhisattva lineage enter.

original: nyan pa la sogs pa'i don rnam pa bzhi la zhugs pa de dag nyid dpe rnam pa bzhis go rims bzhin du gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: nyan pa la sogs pa'i don rnam pa bzhi la zhugs pa de dag nyid dpe rnam pa bzhis go rims bzhin du gsal bar byed do //
translated: Those who have entered the four kinds of aims, listening, etc., are clarified by four examples, respectively.

original: de la re zhig nyan pa'i ched du 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: de la re zhig nyan pa'i ched du 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For the sake of listening, it is like this:

original: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi bu zhig gis 'di lta ste zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi bu zhig gis 'di lta ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: as if a householder or householder's son

original: snga ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa gzung ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa gzung ba'o //
translated: The former is the acceptance of the Bodhisattva vow.

original: phyi ma ni de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: The latter is other than that,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ma bzung ba'o //

original: 'o na ji ltar zhugs pa yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhugs pa yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that they are established as having entered?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they generate the Thought of Enlightenment in dependence on a spiritual teacher.

original: nor bu rin po che brgya stong ri ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i gnas nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che brgya stong ri ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i gnas nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa jewel worth a hundred thousand‚Äù indicates the basis of attachment.

original: khyim bdag dag ni de nyid la gces par sems so //
analyzed: khyim bdag dag ni de nyid la gces par sems so //
translated: Householders cherish it.

original: nor bu rin po che stor te /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che stor te /
translated: When a jewel is lost,

original: mi snang bar gyur na sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur na sdug bsngal te /
translated: there is suffering.

original: lus kyi mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Physical discomfort arises.

original: sems mya ngan gyis non pa 'dis lus kyang gdungs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mya ngan gyis non pa 'dis lus kyang gdungs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this mental distress torments the body.

original: mya ngan las yid gang gis gzhan mi sems mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yid mi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las yid gang gis gzhan mi sems mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yid mi bde ba yin no //
translated: Mental distress is that mental activity by which the mind is not at peace and does not grasp other objects.

original: de nyid rnyed na bde ba dang yid bde ba skye zhing zhes bya ba ni lus @66b kyi dang yid kyi bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnyed na bde ba dang yid bde ba skye zhing zhes bya ba ni lus @66b kyi dang yid kyi bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When that jewel is found, there is the arising of pleasure and mental pleasure, because there is a distinction between physical pleasure and mental pleasure.

original: bde ba de gnyis kyi rgyu ni kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba de gnyis kyi rgyu ni kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cause of those two kinds of pleasure is the absence of the mental activity of the fetters.

original: don la sbyar ba ni 'od srungs de bzhin du dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: don la sbyar ba ni 'od srungs de bzhin du dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The application to the meaning is as follows: ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this: a monk, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i bar du ma thos na 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid smod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bar du ma thos na 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid smod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf I do not hear about the non-existence of entities, etc.,‚Äù is the self-depreciation.

original: bdag cag ces bya ba'i sgra ni smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag ces bya ba'i sgra ni smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúwe‚Äù is for the purpose of deprecation.

original: smod pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: smod pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In order to show the manner of deprecation,

original: 'di lta bu 'di ma thos so snyam du sems so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di ma thos so snyam du sems so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIf I do not hear about the profound perfection of wisdom, etc.,‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI think, ‚ÄòI have not heard this.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par gyur pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par gyur pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal lo //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúAt another time they hear, etc.‚Äù is clear.

original: tshig 'di skad du 'di ltar bdag cag gis zhes bya ba la 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du 'di ltar bdag cag gis zhes bya ba la 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The words ‚Äúin this way we have not heard‚Äù are as follows: ‚Äúin this way‚Äù is the reason.

original: mos pa'i dbang du byas nas 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang du byas nas 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: With regard to the power of devotion, it says, ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For example, the gods of the Thirty-Three...

original: shing yongs 'du dang / sa brtol ni rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: shing yongs 'du dang / sa brtol ni rnam grangs yin la /
translated: The PƒÅrijƒÅta tree and the PƒÅru·π£aka tree are synonyms.

original: de ni me tog gi shing yin te /
analyzed: de ni me tog gi shing yin te /
translated: That is a flowering tree.

original: me tog kha 'bus shing me tog byung du nye ba mthong nas /
analyzed: me tog kha 'bus shing me tog byung du nye ba mthong nas /
translated: When the buds of the flowers are seen to be about to open,

original: ring po mi thogs par myur du 'di na me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro snyam du nges par bzung nas yid dga' ba ste /üîΩde dga' ba skyes so//
analyzed: ring po mi thogs par myur du 'di na me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro snyam du nges par bzung nas yid dga' ba ste / de dga' ba skyes so//
translated: one can be certain that it will not be long before all the flowers will quickly open.üîΩOne's mind is delighted.üîΩThat delight arises.

original: de dag gang la yod pa de rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang la yod pa de rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has that is delighted.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sgra'o //

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor bar byed pa yin no //üîΩyid dga' ba dang zhes bya ba de ni snying dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du dge slong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor bar byed pa yin no // yid dga' ba dang zhes bya ba de ni snying dga' ba'o //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is the same for a monk... and so on is the application to the meaning.üîΩMind is delighted means the heart is delighted.

original: rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni dga' ba dang shin tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni dga' ba dang shin tu ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Delighted means having great delight.

original: de nyid 'dir mos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir mos pa yin te /
translated: That is the faith here.

original: mos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the cause of faith.

original: de bas na 'di thos na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di thos na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf one hears this‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: me tog kha 'bus pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: me tog kha 'bus pa dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is like a flower blooming.üîΩ‚ÄúYou should know for certain, Kashyapa, that they are present in this very assembly of mine.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that you should know for certain that those gods who hear this teaching of the Dharma and have faith and supreme joy in the future are present in this very assembly of mine now.

original: de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srungs khyod kyis nges par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba la yongs 'dus brtol la lha'i bu rnams ji lta ba bzhin du khyod kyis de dag thos nas dad pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba ma 'ongs pa na byed pa de dag kyang da ltar nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par nges par gtan la bab par khyod kyis shes par gyis shig the tshom ma byed cig ces bya @67a * //üîΩba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srungs khyod kyis nges par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba la yongs 'dus brtol la lha'i bu rnams ji lta ba bzhin du khyod kyis de dag thos nas dad pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba ma 'ongs pa na byed pa de dag kyang da ltar nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par nges par gtan la bab par khyod kyis shes par gyis shig the tshom ma byed cig ces bya @67a * //üîΩba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Do not doubt it.

original: nges par shes par byed pa rnam pa gnyis gang dag yin pa de ston par byed pa ni gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par shes par byed pa rnam pa gnyis gang dag yin pa de ston par byed pa ni gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The two kinds of certain knowledge are shown by ‚Äúthose who, in the future time, will not be born in the profound perfection of wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag nga'i 'khor 'dus pa 'di'i nang na ngas rjes su gzung zhing gnas par shes par gyis shig /üîΩshes par bya ba mos pa'i 'bras bu cig shos ston pa ni gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de dag nga'i 'khor 'dus pa 'di'i nang na ngas rjes su gzung zhing gnas par shes par gyis shig / shes par bya ba mos pa'i 'bras bu cig shos ston pa ni gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should know that they will be in my retinue, gathered here, and will be sustained by me.‚Äù

original: yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The other result of interest, which is the object of knowledge, is shown by ‚Äúthose who, in the future time, will be delighted and overjoyed‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: dus shin tu ring pos sangs rgyas kyi me tog thams cad rgyas bar 'gyur bar dogs pa mi bya'i /
analyzed: dus shin tu ring pos sangs rgyas kyi me tog thams cad rgyas bar 'gyur bar dogs pa mi bya'i /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should not doubt that it will take a very long time for all the flowers of the Buddhas to bloom;

original: shing yongs 'du'i me tog kha 'bus pa bzhin ring po mi thogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shing yongs 'du'i me tog kha 'bus pa bzhin ring po mi thogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is like the opening of the flowers of the wish-fulfilling tree‚Äîit will not take long.‚Äù

original: mos pa rnams kyi 'bras bu me tog rgyas pa lta bu ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa rnams kyi 'bras bu me tog rgyas pa lta bu ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of those who have faith?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like the blooming of a flower.

original: me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The blooming of all flowers is the blooming of all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: don la sbyar ba rdzogs nas /
analyzed: don la sbyar ba rdzogs nas /
translated: Having completed the application to the meaning,

original: spyi'i don mjug sdud par byed pa ni 'od srungs 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i don mjug sdud par byed pa ni 'od srungs 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: the summary of the general meaning is: ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this. The profound perfection of wisdom is unborn and non-arisen. ‚Äù

original: 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni dus phyis mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba ni dus phyis mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the future‚Äù means later on, up until the end of nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la gnas par gyur pa dang / sngon med pa thog ma nyid du spyod par 'gyur zhing gnas pa gang yin pa de yang 'od srungs sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rgyud la gnas par gyur pa dang / sngon med pa thog ma nyid du spyod par 'gyur zhing gnas pa gang yin pa de yang 'od srungs sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yin te /
translated: And also, KƒÅ≈õyapa, the person who has entered into nirvƒÅ·πáa of the TathƒÅgata, and who has not previously existed but now exists, that is the Buddha‚Äôs blessing.

original: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis ma brlabs par gyur na gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis ma brlabs par gyur na gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without the Buddha‚Äôs blessing, it would not exist.üîΩIt should be understood as the power of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang gi mthus spyod pa yin gyi de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang gi mthus spyod pa yin gyi de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is conduct by the power of the Buddha‚Äôs might, not otherwise.

original: gal te sdud pa dang / 'jog par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyun mi 'bab na ni don 'di la spyod nus pa su yang med do //
analyzed: gal te sdud pa dang / 'jog par byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyun mi 'bab na ni don 'di la spyod nus pa su yang med do //
translated: If the stream of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom wind-disk that gathers and arranges were not to fall, then no one would be able to practice this meaning.

original: 'od srungs de bas na gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe gsum pa ston par brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bas na gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe gsum pa ston par brtson pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the passage beginning Therefore, Kasyapa, those who say 'this is the perfection of wisdom,' he strives to teach the third example.

original: 'od srungs de ni de dag gi thos ba'i dang po ma yin no @67b zhes bya ba ni sngon yang thos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni de dag gi thos ba'i dang po ma yin no @67b zhes bya ba ni sngon yang thos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Kasyapa, this is not their first hearing means that they have heard it before as well.

original: ji lta zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: How so? To show that, he says, for example, Kasyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na nor bu mkhan zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na nor bu mkhan zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: A jeweler, having seen a piece of ordinary stone, etc.

original: nor bu mkhan de ni nor bu rin po che'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / ngo bo nyid dang / skyon dang yon tan shes pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu mkhan de ni nor bu rin po che'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / ngo bo nyid dang / skyon dang yon tan shes pa'o //
translated: The jeweler knows the cause, result, nature, faults, and qualities of a precious gem.

original: des nor bu rin po che mthong nas /
analyzed: des nor bu rin po che mthong nas /
translated: Having seen a precious gem,

original: gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur cing yid dga' bar gyur pa de ni nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po che de gzod mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni sngon nas rgyun du nor bu mkhan 'dis /üîΩnor bu rin po che'i rigs su gtogs pa 'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur cing yid dga' bar gyur pa de ni nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po che de gzod mthong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang de ni sngon nas rgyun du nor bu mkhan 'dis / nor bu rin po che'i rigs su gtogs pa 'am /
translated: When he is delighted and his mind is delighted, then the jeweler sees that jewel for the first time.üîΩBut he has seen that jewel, which belongs to the family of precious jewels,

original: nor bu rin po 'di nyid sngon lan du ma mthong ba yin no //üîΩ'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: nor bu rin po 'di nyid sngon lan du ma mthong ba yin no // 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: or that very precious jewel itself, many times before.üîΩJust so, Ka≈õyapa, those who hear the perfection of wisdom and so on, and are delighted and very much delighted,

original: 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar gyur cing zhes bya ba de gnyis ni mos pa dang ldan pa de'i rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar gyur cing zhes bya ba de gnyis ni mos pa dang ldan pa de'i rtags yin te /
translated: those two are the signs of that one who has devotion.

original: de gnyis kyang de'i rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang de'i rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those two are the signs of that one who has devotion.

original: mgu ba ni rab tu mgu ba yin no //
analyzed: mgu ba ni rab tu mgu ba yin no //
translated: Delighted means very much delighted.

original: gang dag la rangs pa dang yid bde ba skyes pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag la rangs pa dang yid bde ba skyes pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who have generated joy and mental satisfaction are called that.

original: 'di gnyis dang / mgu ba ni kun shes pa la rtags lhag par yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang / mgu ba ni kun shes pa la rtags lhag par yod pa yin la /
translated: These two and delight are the special signs of complete knowledge.

original: yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba gnyis mos pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba gnyis mos pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both mental satisfaction and full delight also exist in faith.

original: yid dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de dag gi gzod thog mar thos pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yid dga' ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa de dag gi gzod thog mar thos pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who possess mental satisfaction and so on do not initially hear this Dharma,

original: sngon yang thos pa yin par yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon yang thos pa yin par yid ches par bya'o //
translated: but one should have confidence that they have heard it previously.

original: bzhi pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i ched du rtsom par byed pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i ched du rtsom par byed pa /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of the fourth, the author composes:

original: 'od srungs de dag ni 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gsal lo //
analyzed: 'od srungs de dag ni 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don gsal lo //
translated: KaSyapa, they will speak in this way and so on, which is clear in meaning.

original: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus na rgyu dang rjes su mthun par bsnyen bkur byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus na rgyu dang rjes su mthun par bsnyen bkur byas pa ste /
translated: They have previously served Manjusri, the youthful one means that in the past they served in accordance with the cause.

original: 'dir de dang mthun par bsnyen bkur byas pa ni yon tan gang gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di /
analyzed: 'dir de dang mthun par bsnyen bkur byas pa ni yon tan gang gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di /
translated: Here, serving in accordance with that means by what qualities Manjusri, the youthful one,

original: de ltar ston par mdzad pa'i yon tan de'i grogs byas pa dang / rjes su yi rangs pa dang / 'dod pa dang lhag par mos pa la sogs pa gang gis byas pa de dag gis de ltar bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ston par mdzad pa'i yon tan de'i grogs byas pa dang / rjes su yi rangs pa dang / 'dod pa dang lhag par mos pa la sogs pa gang gis byas pa de dag gis de ltar bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no //
translated: Those who have thus served, rejoiced, desired, and aspired to the qualities of the Teacher who acts in this way have thus served him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don 'di nyid rnam pa mang du @68a * //üîΩgtan la phab bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don 'di nyid rnam pa mang du @68a * // gtan la phab bo //
translated: The Lord has also established this meaning in many ways.

original: re zhig rin po che skar mda' las kyang //
analyzed: re zhig rin po che skar mda' las kyang //
translated: For example, in the Rat-na-megha:

original: yon tan gang gis gang zhig 'od zer 'gyed //
analyzed: yon tan gang gis gang zhig 'od zer 'gyed //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what qualities does one emit light?

original: yon tan de la gang gis sngon grogs byas //
analyzed: yon tan de la gang gis sngon grogs byas //
translated: Those qualities which one‚Äôs friends have previously produced

original: de la de dag 'od zer rab tu 'gyed //
analyzed: de la de dag 'od zer rab tu 'gyed //
translated: are emitted as light by those who have them.

original: 'di ni drang srong mkhyen pa'i cho 'phrul yin //
analyzed: 'di ni drang srong mkhyen pa'i cho 'phrul yin //
translated: This is the miracle of the knowledge of the Sage.üîΩThose who have previously served his merit,üîΩthose who have desired and rejoiced in it,

original: de yi bsod nams sngon chad grogs byas dang // gang gis 'dod dang rjes su yi rang dang // gang gis mthong ngam dge ba brtsams de dag //
analyzed: de yi bsod nams sngon chad grogs byas dang // gang gis 'dod dang rjes su yi rang dang // gang gis mthong ngam dge ba brtsams de dag //
translated: those who have seen it or begun wholesome actions,

original: de yis 'od zer 'di dag mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis 'od zer 'di dag mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: they will see this light.

original: gang gis bsod nams byas shing dge bsags dang // gang gis yang dang yang du sangs rgyas mchod //
analyzed: gang gis bsod nams byas shing dge bsags dang // gang gis yang dang yang du sangs rgyas mchod //
translated: Those who have made offerings to the buddhas again and again,

original: sangs rgyas yon tan 'dod cing mos pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yon tan 'dod cing mos pa la //
translated: Those who desire and aspire to the qualities of buddhahood,

original: de dag rnams kyi 'od zer skul bar byed //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi 'od zer skul bar byed //
translated: They are inspired by these light rays.

original: ji ltar nyi ma dmus long mi mthong yang //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma dmus long mi mthong yang //
translated: Just as the blind do not see the sun,

original: 'jig rten dag na shar bcas de med min //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na shar bcas de med min //
translated: But it is not that it does not exist in the world,

original: mig dang ldan pas shar ba mthong nas ni //
analyzed: mig dang ldan pas shar ba mthong nas ni //
translated: Those who have eyes see it rising,

original: kun kyang rang rang rnams kyi mos la sbyor //
analyzed: kun kyang rang rang rnams kyi mos la sbyor //
translated: And all apply themselves according to their aspirations.

original: de ltar skyes bu chen po'i 'od zer de //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu chen po'i 'od zer de //
translated: In the same way, the light rays of the great being

original: yod kyang dman pa rnams kyis de mi mthong //
analyzed: yod kyang dman pa rnams kyis de mi mthong //
translated: Exist, but are not seen by the inferior.

original: log pas zil non mos pa nyams pa la //
analyzed: log pas zil non mos pa nyams pa la //
translated: Those whose aspirations have declined, overwhelmed by error,

original: blo can rnams kyi 'od zer dkon pa yin //
analyzed: blo can rnams kyi 'od zer dkon pa yin //
translated: For them, the light rays of the wise are rare.

original: rgyan dang nor bu bzhon pa gzhal med khang //
analyzed: rgyan dang nor bu bzhon pa gzhal med khang //
translated: Ornaments, jewels, vehicles, palaces,

original: rin chen bcud len dri bsung byug pa rnams //
analyzed: rin chen bcud len dri bsung byug pa rnams //
translated: Precious essences, fragrant ointments,

original: de yang chen por gyur pa rnams la yod //
analyzed: de yang chen por gyur pa rnams la yod //
translated: Those too exist for the great ones,

original: dman par gyur pa rnams la de dag dkon //
analyzed: dman par gyur pa rnams la de dag dkon //
translated: But are rare for the inferior.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: ye shes sems dpa' la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams des bstan pa la lhag par mos pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams des bstan pa la lhag par mos pa'am /
translated: What person who has not served the wisdom being can have faith in the teaching,

original: shes pa 'am /
analyzed: shes pa 'am /
translated: or can understand it,

original: sgom par nus pa su zhig yod /
analyzed: sgom par nus pa su zhig yod /
translated: or can meditate on it?

original: sngon bsgom pa rjes su myong ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon bsgom pa rjes su myong ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make clear the experience of previous meditation,

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi la la zhig grong ngam /üîΩgrong khyer ram /
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig grong ngam / grong khyer ram /
translated: For example, some person has gone to some village,üîΩtown,üîΩcity,

original: grong rdal lam /üîΩljongs gang yang rung ba zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: grong rdal lam / ljongs gang yang rung ba zhig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: or country.

original: dgos pa la la'i phyir son par gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni grong la sogs pa'i nang du yun ring du mi 'dug pa dang / de'i yon tan rjes su myong ba yun thung ba nyid du bstan to //üîΩde las gzhan der song ba kha cig ni de'i yul mi 'am /
analyzed: dgos pa la la'i phyir son par gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni grong la sogs pa'i nang du yun ring du mi 'dug pa dang / de'i yon tan rjes su myong ba yun thung ba nyid du bstan to // de las gzhan der song ba kha cig ni de'i yul mi 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor the sake of some need‚Äù indicates that he does not stay long in the village, etc., and that the experience of its good qualities is short.üîΩSome others who have gone there know the good qualities of the country,

original: grong de la sogs pa'i yon tan shes pa yin no //
analyzed: grong de la sogs pa'i yon tan shes pa yin no //
translated: the village, etc.

original: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
analyzed: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
translated: Then, at another time, some person goes to him and asks,üîΩ‚ÄúHey, friend,

original: nye bar song nas /
analyzed: nye bar song nas /
translated: Having approached,

original: mi snga @68b mas mthong ba'i grong khyer de'i bsngags pa yon tan brjod do //
analyzed: mi snga @68b mas mthong ba'i grong khyer de'i bsngags pa yon tan brjod do //
translated: he praises the city that the former man saw.

original: kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya ba ni shing sna tshogs bskyed pa'i ra ba'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya ba ni shing sna tshogs bskyed pa'i ra ba'o //
translated: A park is a garden where various trees are grown.

original: kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: The park is delightful.üîΩIn the phrase the park is delightful,

original: kun dga'i ra ba'i las ni nyams dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba'i las ni nyams dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: the action of the park is to make delightful.

original: de dag gi las ni gzugs dang / sgra dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi las ni gzugs dang / sgra dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: Their action is manifold, due to the various kinds of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The garden is delightful means

original: skyed mos tshal ni spyi'i sna tshogs bskyed pa'i ra ba'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal ni spyi'i sna tshogs bskyed pa'i ra ba'o //
translated: a garden is a place where various things are grown in general.

original: de'i lan gcig cig de dag gi bsngags pa brjod nas des de thos pa dang dga' bar tshor ba ni nyams bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lan gcig cig de dag gi bsngags pa brjod nas des de thos pa dang dga' bar tshor ba ni nyams bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: Having praised them once, he hears that and feels joy, which is the attainment of pleasure.

original: 'di'i yid bde ba bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yid bde ba bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The production of pleasure in him is called the production of pleasure in him.

original: yang dang yang du 'di skad du /
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'di skad du /
translated: Again and again he says,

original: kye skyes bu de nyid zlos te brjod cig ces 'chol na zhes bya ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: kye skyes bu de nyid zlos te brjod cig ces 'chol na zhes bya ba ni gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: skyes bu de skad smra ba de ni me tog dang 'bras bu nyams dga' bdag kyang sngon myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de skad smra ba de ni me tog dang 'bras bu nyams dga' bdag kyang sngon myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That man who speaks in this way will understand that I have also experienced the delightful flowers and fruits before.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni nyams dga' ba sngon ma myong yang thos na dga' ba mthong ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni nyams dga' ba sngon ma myong yang thos na dga' ba mthong ste /
translated: The thought is that even though one has not experienced the delightful [flowers and fruits] before, one sees that one is delighted upon hearing about them.

original: des na ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na ma nges pa nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is uncertain.

original: lan du bsam pa gsal bar byed pa de la yod pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan du bsam pa gsal bar byed pa de la yod pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag thun mong ma yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
