translated: In response, in order to clarify the thought and teach the uncommon specific aspects that exist in that [thought],

original: 'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Thus, having heard that, the mind is greatly delighted... and so forth.

original: mgu ba dang zhes bya ba de ni rab tu dga' bas gzengs mthos pa ste /
analyzed: mgu ba dang zhes bya ba de ni rab tu dga' bas gzengs mthos pa ste /
translated: Delight is the uplifting of the mind through great joy.

original: de ni snying dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de ni snying dga' ba'o //
translated: That is the delight of the heart.

original: 'di'i rangs pa dang yid bde ba skyes pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rangs pa dang yid bde ba skyes pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The joy and mental satisfaction that arise from that are called that.

original: rjes su myong ba mi 'khrul bar yod pa'i chos rjod par byed pa dang / de las gzhan pa dag gis kyang nges par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su myong ba mi 'khrul bar yod pa'i chos rjod par byed pa dang / de las gzhan pa dag gis kyang nges par byed do //
translated: One expresses the Dharma that exists without confusing the experience, and one also ascertains it through others.

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don la sbyor ba'o //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, in the same way, those who have served the youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´... and so on is the application to the meaning.

original: bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa'i bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bstan pa'i bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
translated: They have served him is the service as taught.

original: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du song zhing 'dri ba byas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du song zhing 'dri ba byas par gyur pa'o //
translated: They have gone again and again is having gone again and again and asked.

original: 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having heard this, they have become very joyful and delighted is the arising of what has not arisen before.

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher bskyed cing @69a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher bskyed cing @69a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They have generated great joy and delight.

original: cher zhes bya ba ni rgya cher ro //
analyzed: cher zhes bya ba ni rgya cher ro //
translated: Great means vast.

original: bskyed pa ni phyis kyang yod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa ni phyis kyang yod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: And the development is the later existence.

original: skyes pa myur du mi 'jig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes pa myur du mi 'jig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that what has arisen does not quickly perish.

original: dga' ba'i rtags ni spong bar mi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rtags ni spong bar mi 'dod pa ste /
translated: The sign of joy is the desire to not abandon.

original: tshig 'di skad du ma la 'di lta ste /üîΩma skyes pa dang ma byung ba nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du ma la 'di lta ste / ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The words are: ‚ÄúMother, I do not want to abandon this.

original: 'di lta bu 'di nyid mnyan to zhes smra bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di nyid mnyan to zhes smra bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: I want to hear just this, from the beginning, ‚Äònot arisen, not occurred,‚Äô up to ‚Äònot ceased, not passed away.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan sel ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan sel ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust this‚Äù is the exclusion of another.

original: de nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the very thing that is done.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na /
translated: At that time, when the Bhagavatƒ´ is not present,

original: dad pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dad pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: those sons or daughters of good lineage who have faith,

original: de'i tshe na lus dang ngag dang sems la rnam pa yod par gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na lus dang ngag dang sems la rnam pa yod par gyur pa'i phyir rnam pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äúat that time, because of the existence of the aspects in body, speech, and mind, the aspects are the Joyful One and so forth.

original: sngon gyi nyan pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir rtags so //üîΩma 'ongs ba'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi nyan pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog par byed pa'i phyir rtags so // ma 'ongs ba'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a sign because it is an inference of former listening, faith, and so on.üîΩIt is a cause because it is the cause of future unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan te /
translated: It is a reason because it is the reason for the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag nyid lags sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris so //
analyzed: de dag nyid lags sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris so //
translated: Are they just those?

original: 'od srungs ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is just as you have said and so on is the answer.

original: de ltar rnam pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / rnam pa la sogs pa don dam pa nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa la sogs pa bstan pa dang / rnam pa la sogs pa don dam pa nyid yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In that way, in order to teach the aspects and so on, and to eliminate the aspects and so on as being ultimate reality,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Blessed One, that dharma is without aspects and so on.

original: 'di la rnam pa yod pa ma yin pas rnam pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa yod pa ma yin pas rnam pa med pa ste /
translated: Here, because it does not exist with aspects, it is without aspects.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chos de ni ngo bo nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir rnam pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chos de ni ngo bo nyid ma skyes pa'i phyir rnam pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the factors of enlightenment is the Dharma connected with ordinary people, etc. That is not a mode, because it is not born by its own nature.

original: tshul de lta bu la rjes su dpag par bya ba med pa'i phyir rtags ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: tshul de lta bu la rjes su dpag par bya ba med pa'i phyir rtags ma mchis pa'o //
translated: In that way, there is no reason, because there is no inferential object.

original: rgyu mtshan ma mchis pa zhes ma gsungs pa ni mos pa la sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin par dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ma mchis pa zhes ma gsungs pa ni mos pa la sogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin par dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not mentioned, because there is no doubt that faith, etc. are its reason.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid kyang rnam pa ma mchis pa'o //üîΩbar gyi sgras rtags ma mchis pa bzung la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thugs su chud pa'i bdag nyid kyang rnam pa ma mchis pa'o // bar gyi sgras rtags ma mchis pa bzung la /
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, whose nature is the realization of the perfection of wisdom, is also without mode.üîΩThe intervening word ‚Äúreason‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is without signs, it is unborn.

original: spyir bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa 'am /
analyzed: spyir bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa 'am /
translated: In order to teach in general, it is said:

original: rtags sam mtshan ma ci rigs @69b par ;
analyzed: rtags sam mtshan ma ci rigs @69b par ;
translated: ‚ÄúAny mode, reason, or sign.‚Äù

original: ji lta bu zhig rnam pa gang zhig mchis par 'gyur bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa sgra'i bdag nyid gang lags pa de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin du rnam pa ma mchis /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig rnam pa gang zhig mchis par 'gyur bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa sgra'i bdag nyid gang lags pa de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de bzhin du rnam pa ma mchis /
translated: What kind of thing is it? What is its aspect? The Dharma teaching of the Bhagavat, which is of the nature of sound, is also unborn, and therefore it is without aspect,

original: rtags ma mchis mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na /üîΩdes na de ltar na /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis mtshan ma ma mchis pa lags na / des na de ltar na /
translated: without sign, and without a distinguishing sign.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams mchis par ji ltar bstan cing bshad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma rnams mchis par ji ltar bstan cing bshad /
translated: Therefore, Bhagavat, how can you teach and explain that aspects, signs, and distinguishing signs exist?

original: don dam par rnam pa la sogs pa mi srid par de skad ces gsol ba dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam pa las gzhan ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par rnam pa la sogs pa mi srid par de skad ces gsol ba dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam pa las gzhan ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is said that ultimately aspects and so on are impossible, in order to teach that they are not different from the conventional aspects,

original: 'jam dpal de dag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de dag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan na /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, when you teach this profound perfection of wisdom, which is completely unborn and up to non-entityness,

original: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Those sons and daughters of good lineage who have faith in it up to those who make it their own are the signs, the indications, the tokens of those sons and daughters of good lineage.

original: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Those very ones means the aspects that have just been taught.

original: de ni gang zag sngar bstan pa de dgra gi rnam pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang zag sngar bstan pa de dgra gi rnam pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Those persons are the ones who have been taught previously.

original: gang zag de ston pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de ston pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of those persons is the profound perfection of wisdom, which is completely non-arisen, etc.

original: kun chub bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kun chub bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Making it their own means taking it up.

original: de nyid de'i rigs can thos pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa yin te de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i rigs can thos pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa yin te de bstan par bya'o //
translated: They are the ones who have the lineage, who have the practice of hearing, etc. They should be taught.

original: de bas na de gleng ba'i ched du 'jam dpal gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de gleng ba'i ched du 'jam dpal gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to discuss them, it is said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, wherever the perfection of wisdom is taught, there, etc.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa bshad pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa bshad pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The explanation of the perfection of wisdom as the nature of the cause is because it is the unmistaken cause just as it is.

original: der sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa mtha' dag bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa mtha' dag bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, should not be taught there.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa dang / mthu dang phrin las la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang de ltar bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa dang / mthu dang phrin las la sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang de ltar bstan par blta'o //
translated: That which is taught as the inconceivable emanations of body, speech, and mind of the Buddhas, their powers, activities, and so forth, should be seen as just that.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas nyid du bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis 'gyur ba de yongs su rdzogs pa yang 'di nyid kyis 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas nyid du bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis 'gyur ba de yongs su rdzogs pa yang 'di nyid kyis 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the perfection of wisdom is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of a Buddha, it is said:

original: 'jam dpal nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal nga sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, when I was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva...

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba @70a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba @70a * //
translated: The roots of virtue

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa 'am /üîΩ'jig rten pa 'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba rgyur gyur pa gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dge ba de dag yang dag par bsgrub par 'dod /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa 'am / 'jig rten pa 'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba rgyur gyur pa gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i dge ba de dag yang dag par bsgrub par 'dod /
translated: Those who wish to accomplish or generate the virtues that are related to the perfections,

original: bskyed par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang dngos po med pa dang skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid klog pa dang / 'chad pa na mnyan par bya /
analyzed: bskyed par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang dngos po med pa dang skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid klog pa dang / 'chad pa na mnyan par bya /
translated: or the virtues that are mundane or supramundane causes by which one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should read, recite, and explain this perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of being unborn, unreal, and not arisen.

original: de de bzhin no zhes nges par 'dzin par mos par bya /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes nges par 'dzin par mos par bya /
translated: They should think, It is just like that! and ascertain it.

original: glegs bam yi ger 'bri bar bya /
analyzed: glegs bam yi ger 'bri bar bya /
translated: They should write it out in a book.

original: tshig dang don mi brjed par gzung bar bya /
analyzed: tshig dang don mi brjed par gzung bar bya /
translated: They should memorize the words and their meanings so that they are not forgotten.

original: glegs bam bklag par bya /
analyzed: glegs bam bklag par bya /
translated: They should read the book.

original: gzhan las lung ma nod par bya /
analyzed: gzhan las lung ma nod par bya /
translated: They should receive oral transmissions from others.

original: srod dang tho rangs la kha ton du bya /
analyzed: srod dang tho rangs la kha ton du bya /
translated: They should recite it in the evening and the morning.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la ji ltar yod par 'gyur ba de ltar tshig tu gdon par bya /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la ji ltar yod par 'gyur ba de ltar tshig tu gdon par bya /
translated: One should recite the words in such a way that they are present in one's own and others' mind streams.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis kun chub par bya /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis kun chub par bya /
translated: One should master them by way of taking hold of all the aspects.

original: de dang rjes su mthun par sems pas tshul bzhin yid la bya /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun par sems pas tshul bzhin yid la bya /
translated: One should properly attend to them by way of thinking in accordance with them.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya /
translated: One should cultivate them by way of not observing any phenomena.

original: rgyal mtshan dang ba dan gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba la bye brag tu ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang ba dan gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba la bye brag tu ni 'di yin te /
translated: The victory banner and the flag are distinguished in that

original: rgyal mtshan ni mtshan ma can la rgyu nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan ni mtshan ma can la rgyu nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: the victory banner has no fixed cause, but is a sign of victory.

original: ba dan ni mtshan ma med pa la gos kyi rgyu las byas pa'o //
analyzed: ba dan ni mtshan ma med pa la gos kyi rgyu las byas pa'o //
translated: The flag is made of cloth, and has no sign.

original: de bong chung ba ni rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan yin no //
analyzed: de bong chung ba ni rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan yin no //
translated: The small flag is the flag of victory.

original: ci nus zhes bya ba ni me tog la sogs pa'i nang nas gang ci tsam yod par nus pa des de srid du nges par mchod par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci nus zhes bya ba ni me tog la sogs pa'i nang nas gang ci tsam yod par nus pa des de srid du nges par mchod par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As much as one is able means that one should make offerings to the best of one's ability with whatever flowers, etc. are available. This is the meaning of as much as one is able.

original: 'di ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yan lag yin te /üîΩrtag tu ngu la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yan lag yin te / rtag tu ngu la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: This is the limb of pure superior intention.üîΩEven though it is difficult, like Sadaprarudita,

original: dka' ba yin du zin kyang mi ldog par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba yin du zin kyang mi ldog par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: one does not turn back from the application.

original: ci phod du zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mthus mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: ci phod du zhes bya ba ni lus kyi mthus mi ldog pa'o //
translated: One should not turn back means that one should not turn back due to the weakness of one's body.

original: rim gror bya'o zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba yin gyi ma gus par ma yin te ;
analyzed: rim gror bya'o zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba yin gyi ma gus par ma yin te ;
translated: One should serve means that one should do it respectfully, not disrespectfully,

original: mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu stan las ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: and one should stand up immediately upon seeing the teacher, and do such things as join one's palms in respect.

original: 'di ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i yan lag yin te /
translated: This is the limb of pure intention,

original: sgyu dang g-yo spangs te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo spangs te sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one applies oneself without deceit or guile.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi ngo bo yin la /
translated: The accumulation of merit is the essence of the three perfections beginning with generosity.

original: @70b de'i bar chad byed pa theg pa dman pa yin la byed pa ni pas pham pa bas kyang shin tu lci ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @70b de'i bar chad byed pa theg pa dman pa yin la byed pa ni pas pham pa bas kyang shin tu lci ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the Hinayana is an obstacle to that, it is a downfall that is heavier than a root downfall.

original: sa dang rigs dang 'jug pa la sogs pa thams cad las 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa dang rigs dang 'jug pa la sogs pa thams cad las 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: One should transcend all grounds, lineages, and engagements.

original: 'jam dpal ji ltar rnam pa gang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni gzugs la sogs pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ji ltar rnam pa gang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni gzugs la sogs pa las phyir ldog pa la sogs pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, in what way and by what means does the irreversible ground turn away from form and so on, and so forth?

original: de la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: One should engage in that,üîΩone should understand that,

original: khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: one should realize that.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de lta bur nyan par 'dod pa de nges par 'dzin par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de lta bur nyan par 'dod pa de nges par 'dzin par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid mnyan par bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to listen in that way, who wishes to ascertain that, should listen to this perfection of wisdom itself, which is unborn, non-arising, and essentially unreal.

original: sa de 'thob pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: sa de 'thob pa ni rnam pa gzhan gyis ma yin te /
translated: Attaining that ground is not by any other means.

original: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two dharmas for not turning away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du blta ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid du blta ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: He views all phenomena as emptiness, and he does not abandon any sentient being.

original: de gnyis kyang 'di nyid las gsungs te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang 'di nyid las gsungs te /
translated: These two are taught in this very [scripture].

original: 'og nas rim gyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'og nas rim gyis ston par byed do //
translated: They will be taught in order below.

original: 'jam dpal chos gang yang rung so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag thams cad ma skyes pas na mnyam pa nyid skye ba med pa'o zhes mtshan nyid gcig po 'di la mos shing nges par 'dzin par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal chos gang yang rung so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa de dag thams cad ma skyes pas na mnyam pa nyid skye ba med pa'o zhes mtshan nyid gcig po 'di la mos shing nges par 'dzin par 'dod pas so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, all those phenomena that are related to ordinary beings and so forth, because they are unborn, are the same in being unborn.

original: 'di ni 'dir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rtsa ba dang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rtsa ba dang rgyu yin no //
translated: This is the root and cause of the accumulation of wisdom here.

original: lhag ma ni de nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: The remainder is its result and classification.

original: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the result, [the Buddha] said:

original: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, for one who desires to fully awaken to all the qualities of a Buddha...

original: 'jam dpal chos thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal chos thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the TathƒÅgata has fully awakened to all dharmas in this way.

original: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected to another stage:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bstan pa 'di la mos shing nges par byed pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas kyang mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bstan pa 'di la mos shing nges par byed pa'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has conviction in this teaching, who is certain that the TathƒÅgata has fully awakened, has also fully awakened.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mos pa 'di ji ltar mchog yin zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mos pa 'di ji ltar mchog yin zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: Why is that? means ‚ÄúHow is this conviction supreme?‚Äù

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba byed pa 'am zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba byed pa 'am zhes bya ba ni khong du chud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is fully awakened‚Äù means ‚Äúthat which is realized.‚Äù

original: lam shes pa gang gis @71a * //
analyzed: lam shes pa gang gis @71a * //
translated: By what knowledge of the path

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am /
translated: is it fully awakened?

original: chos gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya zhing khong du chud par bya ba'i chos de gang yang med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya zhing khong du chud par bya ba'i chos de gang yang med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever that is fully awakened, that is realized. Because it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar don 'di rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni don shes par ro //
analyzed: de ltar don 'di rtogs shing zhes bya ba ni don shes par ro //
translated: Thus, having understood this meaning means having understood the meaning.

original: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par mnyam par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni skye ba med par mnyam par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no dharma at all that is not enlightenment means that there is no distinction in terms of the sameness of non-arising.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that all dharmas are non-conceptual.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'dod pas /
translated: Desiring to abandon the concepts of object and subject,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas /
translated: one should listen to just this perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of non-arising,

original: rim gro'i bar du bya ste /
analyzed: rim gro'i bar du bya ste /
translated: and should serve it,

original: 'di nyid la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di nyid la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and should practice just this. This is the meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that? means What is the reason for this?

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, The perfection of wisdom is not of any dharma and so on.

original: chos gang gi yongs su grub cing yod par bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gang gi yongs su grub cing yod par bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not generate the perfect and existent of any dharma.

original: skye ba bkag na de mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa ston pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba bkag na de mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa ston pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If arising is refuted, the perfect is not taught because it is not perceived.

original: yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ston pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa med pa'i phyir ston pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a teacher when the perfect does not exist?

original: chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: All dharmas are neither defiled nor purified.

original: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not inherently arisen.

original: chos thams cad 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: All dharmas are neither past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin da ltar byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin da ltar byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba de la /
translated: nor future, nor present.

original: mos par bya ba dang / nges par bya ba dang / 'jug par bya bar 'dod pas 'di nyid la mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: mos par bya ba dang / nges par bya ba dang / 'jug par bya bar 'dod pas 'di nyid la mnyan par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to believe, to be certain, and to engage should listen to just this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the nature of non-arising.

original: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni dus su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni dus su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Non-arising and so forth are not included in time.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad de la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad de la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are ultimately unborn.

original: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la /
translated: Thus, all dharmas are directed towards that.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo la the tshom med par gtan la dbab par rtogs par 'dod pa'o //üîΩ'jam dpal lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo la the tshom med par gtan la dbab par rtogs par 'dod pa'o // 'jam dpal lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: In this way, he wishes to understand the ascertainment of the nature of all dharmas without doubt.üîΩMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, how will the wheel of Dharma be turned in three stages and twelve aspects?

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar bskor bar 'gyur ba de zhes bya ba @71b de la ;üîΩsdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa ni bskor ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar bskor bar 'gyur ba de zhes bya ba @71b de la ; sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa ni bskor ba gcig pa'o //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is turned in three stages: the stage of teaching, the stage of attraction, and the stage of establishing.üîΩThe stage of teaching is the teaching of the four noble truths.üîΩThe stage of attraction is the attraction of those to be trained.üîΩThe stage of establishing is the establishment of those to be trained in the result.üîΩThe wheel of Dharma is turned in twelve aspects: the aspects of the four noble truths.üîΩThe aspect of the noble truth of suffering is the knowledge of the nature of the four noble truths.üîΩThe aspect of the noble truth of the origin of suffering is the knowledge of the origin of suffering.üîΩThe aspect of the noble truth of the cessation of suffering is the knowledge of the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //üîΩkun 'byung spang bar bya'o //üîΩ'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o //üîΩkun 'byung spang bar bya'o //üîΩ'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: The aspect of the noble truth of the path is the knowledge of the path.

original: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskor ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskor ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second revolution is:

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: I have understood suffering.

original: kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: I have abandoned origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: I have realized cessation.üîΩI have cultivated the path.

original: lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskor ba gsum pa ste /
analyzed: lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni yongs su bskor ba gsum pa ste /
translated: The third revolution is:üîΩI have understood suffering.üîΩI have understood the origin.üîΩI have understood cessation.üîΩI have understood the path.

original: bden pa re re la yang gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa re re la yang gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir /
translated: Each truth is repeated three times,

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa 'di rnam pa bcu gnyis yin pas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa 'di rnam pa bcu gnyis yin pas /
translated: so this threefold repetition has twelve aspects.

original: gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gsum du bzlas pa rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve aspects of the threefold revolution.

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa bcu gnyis kyi chos ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa bcu gnyis kyi chos ni bsod nams te /
translated: The Dharma of the twelve aspects of the threefold revolution is merit.

original: nges par legs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par legs pa dang / mngon par mtho ba bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish definite goodness and high status.

original: chos de 'khor lo bzhin du gdul bya'i rgyud la bskor ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: chos de 'khor lo bzhin du gdul bya'i rgyud la bskor ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: The turning of that Dharma in the mindstream of disciples like a wheel is the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: ji ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang chos mnyan pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / yongs su smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang chos mnyan pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / yongs su smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par ji ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: How does it occur? It occurs in the form of the generation and maturation of the roots of virtue that lead to the attainment of seeing the Tathagata and hearing the Dharma.

original: de nyan par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyan par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go rims bzhin du thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Desiring to hear, etc. means that, respectively, one desires to hear, to think, and to cultivate.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to not abandoning any sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par 'dod la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par 'dod la zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúone desires to pervade all sentient beings with lovingkindness.‚Äù

original: shin tu bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rgyas pa ni bdag dang sems can dang / bde ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rgyas pa ni bdag dang sems can dang / bde ba rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: Pervasion by the nature of the desire for the possession of supreme happiness is the pervasion of self, sentient beings, and happiness by means of the nonapprehension of self, sentient beings, and happiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can du 'du shes pa la yang mi gnas par 'dod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can du 'du shes pa la yang mi gnas par 'dod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúHe does not even stand in the notion of a being.‚Äù

original: shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa'i thabs rtsod pa med pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa'i thabs rtsod pa med pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the method of being endowed with the highest happiness, which is free of conflict,üîΩit says, ‚ÄúHe does not even stand in the notion of a being.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a being, because he does not stand in the notion of a world.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang rtsod pa med par yang 'dod cing zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang rtsod pa med par yang 'dod cing zhes gsungs te /
translated: He does not stand in the notion of a world, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of beings.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of beings, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of worlds.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of worlds, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of space.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of space, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of phenomena.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of phenomena, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of dharmas.

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig @72a * //
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig @72a * //
translated: He does not stand in the notion of a realm of dharmas, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of suchness.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of suchness, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of reality.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of reality, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the dharma-constituent.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of the dharma-constituent, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inconceivable.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inconceivable, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the unapprehendable.

original: rten gyi khams su gtogs pa de dang lhan cig rtsod pa med par 'dod pa ni bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mthun par ston par nye bar sgrub pa dang / mi mthun par smra ba sel bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi khams su gtogs pa de dang lhan cig rtsod pa med par 'dod pa ni bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mthun par ston par nye bar sgrub pa dang / mi mthun par smra ba sel bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: He does not stand in the notion of a realm of the unapprehendable, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inexpressible.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inexpressible, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the unutterable.üîΩHe does not stand in the notion of a realm of the unutterable, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inexpressible.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mi dmigs pa ni dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mi dmigs pa ni dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: He does not stand in the notion of a realm of the inexpressible, because he does not stand in the notion of a realm of the unutter

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bar du rtogs shing mngon du khyab par 'dod pas ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la slob pa po dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bar du rtogs shing mngon du khyab par 'dod pas ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la slob pa po dang /
translated: Because of the wish to realize and pervade all phenomena up to non-arising, one should train in this perfection of wisdom, which is non-arisen, non-arising, and the nature of non-entityness, by way of not apprehending the one who trains,

original: slob pa dang / de'i gnas rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: slob pa dang / de'i gnas rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ste /
translated: the training, and its bases.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni 'di nyid la bslabs pas 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag ni 'di nyid la bslabs pas 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who wish for those arousals of the mind will accomplish them by training in this very [perfection of wisdom],

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not elsewhere. This is the meaning.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs sgrub pa la sogs pa de la phan yon byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs sgrub pa la sogs pa de la phan yon byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that this perfection of wisdom is beneficial for accomplishing the accumulation of merit and so forth,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan ma mchis pa'i yon tan gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yon tan ma mchis pa'i yon tan gang lags /
translated: the Lord said, What are the qualities of the perfection of wisdom that are not qualities?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nus pa ci yang ma mchis pa lags na phan yon ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nus pa ci yang ma mchis pa lags na phan yon ci zhig mchis /
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom has no ability at all, what benefit does it have?

original: yon tan ni bsngags pa yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni bsngags pa yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bya'o //
translated: The qualities are the praised, pleasant results.

original: de dang bral ba ni ci yang byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni ci yang byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Being devoid of that, it is not able to do anything at all.

original: nus pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis thams cad la phan pa med par spyir bstan te /
analyzed: nus pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis thams cad la phan pa med par spyir bstan te /
translated: By this ‚Äúlack of ability,‚Äù it is generally taught that it is not beneficial for anything.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid ni gang du yang nus par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid ni gang du yang nus par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of non-arising, is not reasonable anywhere as having ability.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun nas slong bar mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun nas slong bar mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: It does not motivate the roots of virtue.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: It does not destroy the opposing factors such as attachment.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi chos gang yang mi len pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi chos gang yang mi len pa ste /
translated: It does not take up any irreversible dharmas.

original: thob par mi byed /
analyzed: thob par mi byed /
translated: It does not attain.

original: sgrub par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not accomplish‚Äîthis is the meaning.

original: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa mi spong ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa mi spong ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot undesirable‚Äù means not to abandon the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: g-yo ba ma mchis pa byed pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad la phan pa med par ston te /
analyzed: g-yo ba ma mchis pa byed pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad la phan pa med par ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout movement, without activity‚Äù shows that it is not beneficial for all.

original: 'di ltar g-yo ba dang ldan zhing byed pa po yod na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dman pa'i sa las 'da' ba @72b dang ; phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon pa'i rnam pa thos pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam par mos pa rnams la phan par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar g-yo ba dang ldan zhing byed pa po yod na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dman pa'i sa las 'da' ba @72b dang ; phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon pa'i rnam pa thos pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam par mos pa rnams la phan par byed pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if there were movement and an agent, it would be beneficial for the generation of the roots of virtue, for the transcendence of the lower levels, for the attainment of the irreversible levels, and for the aspiration to the equality of the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ngag go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ngag go //
translated: What is this perfection of wisdom?

original: g-yo ba ma mchis pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba ma mchis pa /
translated: It is without movement,

original: byed pa ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: byed pa ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: without activity.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i don dang / gzhan la phan pa byed par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i don dang / gzhan la phan pa byed par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How can it be beneficial for the meaning that is taught and for others?

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i ye shes dang mthong bas mngon par byang chub pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i ye shes dang mthong bas mngon par byang chub pa yin na /
translated: The essence of all phenomena is fully enlightened by the wisdom and seeing of the noble ones.

original: ye shes dang mthong ba de gnyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes dang mthong ba de gnyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those two, wisdom and seeing, do not exist,

original: chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa la yang 'di phan pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par byang chub pa la yang 'di phan pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: this is not helpful for fully enlightening all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach this, it says, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is not the knowledge of the essence, not the seeing of the essence.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags pa dang / ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags pa dang / ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the knowledge of the essence, not the seeing of the essence‚Äù means that it is not the essence of both.

original: de ltar ye shes la phan pa med par bstan nas bskyed pa la yang phan pa med par ston pa ni chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes la phan pa med par bstan nas bskyed pa la yang phan pa med par ston pa ni chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught that it is not helpful for wisdom, it teaches that it is not helpful for the creation of the buddhas, saying, ‚ÄúIt does not give any dharma at all.‚Äù

original: stobs la sogs pa'i chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid cing /
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa'i chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid cing /
translated: It does not give any dharma at all, such as the powers.

original: yod par mi bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: yod par mi bgyid pa'o //
translated: One does not make them existent.

original: chos thams cad bskyed par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni 'byung bar mi bgyid pa lags na /
analyzed: chos thams cad bskyed par mi bgyid ces bya ba ni 'byung bar mi bgyid pa lags na /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not generate any dharma‚Äù means one does not cause it to arise.

original: chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could one not give any dharma at all?

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad sel bar mi bgyid pa zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'jig par mi byed na ni de ma bcom par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang sbyin par mi byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad sel bar mi bgyid pa zhes 'byung ba de'i tshe ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos rnams 'jig par mi byed na ni de ma bcom par sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang sbyin par mi byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: When it says ‚Äúone does not remove any dharma,‚Äù then if one does not destroy the dharmas of ordinary beings and so on, one should understand that one does not give the dharmas of the buddhas either, since they are not destroyed.

original: de ltar na tshig bzhis mngon par byang chub pa la phan pa med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig bzhis mngon par byang chub pa la phan pa med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the four phrases are not helpful for manifest enlightenment,

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i rnam pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa la mos pa la sogs pa dang / chos skye ba med pa la ston pa dang the tshom med pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i rnam pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas kyang chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa la mos pa la sogs pa dang / chos skye ba med pa la ston pa dang the tshom med pa dang /
translated: The cause of that is the aspect of conviction in the sameness of the non-arising of all phenomena, and the conviction in the teaching that the Tathagata has not fully awakened to all phenomena, and so on.

original: rtogs pa la thug pa rnams la phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa la thug pa rnams la phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the non-arising of phenomena is not taught for those who have not reached realization,

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa ma mchis pa la mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te /üîΩchos @73a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa ma mchis pa la mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te / chos @73a * //
translated: it is said, In the non-differentiation of all phenomena.

original: thams cad tha dad pa ma mchis pa ni dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad tha dad pa ma mchis pa ni dbyer med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are undifferentiated, meaning they are inseparable.

original: de la bgyid pa spyod pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la bgyid pa spyod pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is without activity in that is called thus.

original: de ni chos thams cad tha dad pa med par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad tha dad pa med par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That is not the differentiation of all phenomena.

original: de'i gtan tshigs su ma bgyis pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs su ma bgyis pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The reason for that is stated as not made.

original: byed pa dang bral ba yin na chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'i don la ji ltar phan pa byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa dang bral ba yin na chos thams cad ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'i don la ji ltar phan pa byed par 'gyur /
translated: If it is devoid of activity, how could it benefit the meaning of the statement that all phenomena have the characteristic of one taste?

original: glegs bam kha cig las /
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las /
translated: In some texts, it is stated:

original: chos thams cad tha dad par mi bgyid pa dang / chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa dang / chos thams cad so sor bgyid pa ma lags pa dang / bgyi ba ma mchis pa zhes 'byung ba de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad par mi bgyid pa dang / chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa dang / chos thams cad so sor bgyid pa ma lags pa dang / bgyi ba ma mchis pa zhes 'byung ba de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not made different, all phenomena are not made one, all phenomena are not made distinct, and there is nothing to be done.‚Äù The meaning of this is as follows:

original: tha dad pa nyid du byed pa ni tha dad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du byed pa ni tha dad par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMaking different‚Äù is making different.

original: de yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which does not exist is called that.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /üîΩtha dad pa nyid du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du byed pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te / tha dad pa nyid du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du byed pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this:üîΩ‚ÄúNot making different‚Äù is the negation of making different.

original: chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha dad pa med par byed pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni tha dad pa med par byed pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not made one‚Äù negates making non-different.

original: chos thams cad so sor med par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du byed pa 'gog pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'i rnam grangs yin no //üîΩma bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs su byed pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad so sor med par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du byed pa 'gog pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'i rnam grangs yin no // ma bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa thams cad kyi gtan tshigs su byed pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot making all dharmas non-individual‚Äù is a synonym for the very negation of making them different.

original: byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot making‚Äù is the reason for all that has just been taught, because it is not reasonable to make.

original: de bas na gong du bstan pa'i don la phan pa med pa gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gong du bstan pa'i don la phan pa med pa gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the above is made clear, and it is of no benefit.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rnam pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rnam pa la /
translated: In the aspect of turning the wheel of Dharma,

original: thos pa dang mos pa dang / 'jug pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pa dang mos pa dang / 'jug pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni 'gog pa yin no //
translated: the result of hearing, believing, and engaging is cessation.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa zad pa dang phung po zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa zad pa dang phung po zhig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the exhaustion of afflictions and the destruction of the aggregates.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa gang yin pa de'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa gang yin pa de'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the non-perception of what remains and what does not remain,

original: chos kyi 'khor la bskor ba thos pa la sogs pa la yang phan pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor la bskor ba thos pa la sogs pa la yang phan pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is also useless for turning the wheel of Dharma, listening, and so on.

original: mi bas pa rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi bas pa rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIt does not destroy the inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams dang / phung po rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams dang / phung po rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that, respectively, these are the afflictions and the aggregates.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab pa la yang 'di phan pa med pa bstan @73b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab pa la yang 'di phan pa med pa bstan @73b pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is also useless for pervading all sentient beings with love, he says,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not give the qualities of ordinary beings.‚Äù

original: byams pa ni sems can thams cad la /
analyzed: byams pa ni sems can thams cad la /
translated: Love is the desire that all sentient beings

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: have the highest mundane and supramundane happiness.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: If it does not even give the qualities of ordinary beings,

original: lha dang mi'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa lta ga la yod snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i bde ba sbyin par byed pa lta ga la yod snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could it give the happiness of gods and humans?

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyang sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyang sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: In the same way, if you do not give away even the qualities of an arhat,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba sbyin par lta ga la byed /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba sbyin par lta ga la byed /
translated: how much less so the happiness of nirvana?

original: de bzhin du /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyin par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba la kyang gi sgra ni srid pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyin par bgyid pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba la kyang gi sgra ni srid pa la bya'o //
translated: In the same way,üîΩyou do not give away even the qualities of a Buddha.üîΩThe word ‚Äúeven‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúdo not give away.‚Äù

original: yang gi sgra ni thams cad sbyin par mi bgyid pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni thams cad sbyin par mi bgyid pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù is to be construed with ‚Äúdo not give away.‚Äù

original: bsdu ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the sense of ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su 'khor ba 'dor bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su 'khor ba 'dor bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, in order to state the reason, he says, ‚Äúdo not abandon samsara,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dor bar mi bgyid pa ni spong bar mi bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: 'dor bar mi bgyid pa ni spong bar mi bgyid pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not abandon‚Äù means do not reject.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ma bcom par bde ba sbyin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ma bcom par bde ba sbyin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be a giving of happiness without destroying the suffering of conditioned states?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa len par mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi bgyid pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba sbyin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa len par mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par mi bgyid pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba sbyin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not take up nirvana‚Äù means do not grasp it. Therefore, the giving of the happiness of nirvana does not exist.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha qualities of the powers, etc. are not given.

original: bla na med pa'i bde ba sbyin par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bde ba sbyin par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be the giver of unsurpassed bliss?

original: sngar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes de skad du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes de skad du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Wasn't it previously taught that the Buddha qualities are not given?

original: de yang de bzhin du ston na yang ston pa 'di la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du ston na yang ston pa 'di la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is taught in that way, what is the difference between the previous and this teaching?

original: sngar ni de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa bde ba'i bye brag la ltos te bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa bde ba'i bye brag la ltos te bstan to //
translated: Previously, the TathƒÅgata was taught in terms of the distinction of unsurpassed bliss.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' dag la ltos pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is in terms of all the Buddha qualities.

original: gang na shing med pa de na shing sha pa yang srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang na shing med pa de na shing sha pa yang srid pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as when there is no tree, there is no possibility of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the proof.

original: snga ma ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The previous one is what is to be proven.

original: sems can gyi 'du shes la mi gnas pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes la mi gnas pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is also useless for one who does not abide in the perception of sentient beings,

original: rnam par 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúit is not a destroyer.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the perception of sentient beings.

original: 'di skad bstan te /üîΩsems can gyi 'du shes yod na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @74a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / sems can gyi 'du shes yod na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @74a * //
translated: This is what is being taught:üîΩIf the perception of sentient beings exists, this perfection of wisdom is a destroyer.

original: phyin pa 'di 'jig par byed pa yin la de'i tshe /
analyzed: phyin pa 'di 'jig par byed pa yin la de'i tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: de la mi gnas pa la phan pa byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa la phan pa byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: it is useful for one who does not abide in that, not otherwise.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang lhan cig rtsod pa med pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang lhan cig rtsod pa med pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is also useless for one who does not dispute with the whole world,

original: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúit is not an object of thought,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsam par 'os pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam par 'os pa ni bsam pa'o //
translated: An object of thought is a thought.

original: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags te /
analyzed: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags te /
translated: It is not an object of thought.

original: sems par byed pa stong pa yin na /
analyzed: sems par byed pa stong pa yin na /
translated: If the thinker is empty,

original: sems pa med na mi 'byung ba'i chos 'chad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems pa med na mi 'byung ba'i chos 'chad pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is illogical to explain a phenomenon that does not arise without mind.

original: chos rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can one realize the Dharma?

original: gang gis na rtsod pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na rtsod pa med par 'gyur /
translated: By what means will there be no dispute?

original: de bzhin du bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the same way, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not non-imaginable.‚Äù

original: bsam du ma mchis pa yin no snyam du rnam par rtog cing bsnyems pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam du ma mchis pa yin no snyam du rnam par rtog cing bsnyems pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said that way about that which is not conceited, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is non-imaginable.‚Äù

original: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags pa dang / bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'chad pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
analyzed: bsam par bgyi ba ma lags pa dang / bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis kyis ni 'chad pa mi 'thad par bstan to //
translated: By these two phrases, ‚Äúnot to be imagined‚Äù and ‚Äúnot non-imagined,‚Äù it is shown that explanation is not tenable.

original: de bas na 'di la phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that this is not beneficial,

original: chos rtogs par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos rtogs par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not cause realization of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / som nyi rnams gzhan du 'gyur bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin chos 'chad bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / som nyi rnams gzhan du 'gyur bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin chos 'chad bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not destroy‚Äù means that it does not cause doubt, uncertainty, and confusion to become otherwise, because it teaches the Dharma as it really is.

original: 'jig rten thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med par rtogs pa la yang 'di phan pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is also of no benefit in realizing that all worlds are unapprehendable and in realizing that all phenomena are non-arisen,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
translated: the Lord, the Perfection of Wisdom is up to the non-existence of entities.

original: yon tan gang lags zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan gang lags zhes gsungs so //
translated: What are its qualities?‚Äù

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma skyes pa dang / skye ba med pa nyid bzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes non-arisen and non-production.

original: 'di gnyis lhan cig tu 'dug par rnam pa mang du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis lhan cig tu 'dug par rnam pa mang du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because these two are taught together in many ways.

original: gang yang rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang de yin par sdud pa ni sdud la rag go //
analyzed: gang yang rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang de yin par sdud pa ni sdud la rag go //
translated: It is also possible to include other enumerations.

original: gang ltar yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ltar yang rung ste /
translated: In any case,

original: don tha ma gnyis dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub pa la sogs pa kun la ni de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: don tha ma gnyis dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub pa la sogs pa kun la ni de lta bu yin na /
translated: The last two topics and the cultivation of the roots of virtue and so forth are all like this.

original: re zhig phan pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig phan pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that there is no benefit whatsoever from that,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang lags zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang lags zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat are the qualities of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: yon tan ni phan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan ni phan pa la bya ste /
translated: Qualities are to be understood as benefits.

original: gang gi don du de dang @74b de 'dod pas /
analyzed: gang gi don du de dang @74b de 'dod pas /
translated: For the sake of which, he desires that.

original: 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas /
translated: This very [perfection of wisdom] should be listened to,

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i bar du byed ces dgongs pa'o //üîΩglegs bam kha cig las bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i bar du byed ces dgongs pa'o // glegs bam kha cig las bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: and one should make offerings up to venerating it.üîΩIn some texts, it appears as ‚Äúnot making it, not destroying it,‚Äù

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes 'byung ba'i mjug thogs su dngos po med pa'i bar du zhes bya ba bsal nas /
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes 'byung ba'i mjug thogs su dngos po med pa'i bar du zhes bya ba bsal nas /
translated: immediately after which, up to ‚Äúnon-entity,‚Äù is omitted.

original: chos thams cad bskyed pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad bskyed pa ma lags pa /
translated: [The perfection of wisdom] does not produce all phenomena,

original: 'gog pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa ma lags pa /
translated: does not cease them,

original: 'chad par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'chad par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: does not explain them,

original: rtag par bgyid pa ma lags pa /üîΩ'ong bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: rtag par bgyid pa ma lags pa / 'ong bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: does not make them permanent,üîΩdoes not make them come,

original: 'gro bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'gro bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: does not make them go,

original: dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a state of solitude.

original: mi dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: mi dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a state of non-solitude.

original: gnyis su bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: gnyis su bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a state of duality.üîΩIt is not a state of non-duality.

original: mi gnyis par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes 'byung ba ni gzhung ma yin par mngon te /
analyzed: mi gnyis par bgyid pa ma lags pa zhes 'byung ba ni gzhung ma yin par mngon te /
translated: This is clearly not a scripture,

original: glegs bam du ma las de skad du mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mi smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: glegs bam du ma las de skad du mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mi smos pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur in the many volumes, and because it does not mention the words ‚Äúup to non-entityness.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: This must be stated without doubt.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan du bka' stsal pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan du bka' stsal pa las /
translated: Because the Blessed One said in reply:

original: yon tan gyi mjug tu 'di bka' stsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gyi mjug tu 'di bka' stsal ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is said at the end of the qualities.

original: gong du mi brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gong du mi brjod pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable not to mention it above.‚Äù

original: 'dir lan du /
analyzed: 'dir lan du /
translated: Here, in reply,

original: 'jam dpal g-yo ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal g-yo ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, this very absence of movement up to non-entityness is this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang khyod kyis dang po g-yo ba med pa nas /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis dang po g-yo ba med pa nas /
translated: This is because whatever you said first, from ‚Äúabsence of movement‚Äù up to ‚Äúnon-entityness,‚Äù

original: tha ma dngos po med pa la thug pa'i bar du /
analyzed: tha ma dngos po med pa la thug pa'i bar du /
translated: and finally, up to the non-existence of entities.

original: 'dir smras pa gang yin pa de nyid yon tan yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa gang yin pa de nyid yon tan yin no //
translated: Here, whatever is said is itself a quality.

original: gal te 'di la dngos po yod pa ma yin na ni log par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di la dngos po yod pa ma yin na ni log par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If this does not exist as an entity, then it would be a false superimposition,

original: med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of superimposing on what is non-existent.

original: de'i tshe kun nas slong ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
