analyzed: ting nge 'dzin spyod pas myur du byang chub bar 'gyur ba'i skabs bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the section on quickly attaining enlightenment through samƒÅdhi practice,

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, moreover, one who has attained samƒÅdhi... and so forth is stated.

original: myur du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩting nge 'dzin la ji ltar 'jug par bya @80a * //
analyzed: myur du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'o // ting nge 'dzin la ji ltar 'jug par bya @80a * //
translated: Quickly attaining the factors of enlightenment refers to the foundations of mindfulness and so forth.

original: ba dang de'i bsngags pa ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: ba dang de'i bsngags pa ni bstan zin to //
translated: How to enter samƒÅdhi and its praises have already been explained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la spyod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la spyod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom has three types of patience for one who practices it:

original: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It is born of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: de la sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the patience that follows sound,

original: 'jam dpal gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi tshe bdag gi dbyings nas chos kyi dbyings kyi bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang gi tshe bdag gi dbyings nas chos kyi dbyings kyi bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMoreover, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, when the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva does not see the realm of self up to the realm of phenomena,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes pa'i tshe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù refers to the time of the knowledge of hearing.

original: bdag gi dbyings zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang gi ngo bo la bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dbyings zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang gi ngo bo la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe realm of self‚Äù means the essence of self.

original: mi mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be connected with ‚Äúdoes not see.‚Äù

original: bar gyi sgras bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i dbyings la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sgras bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i dbyings la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes the inconceivable realm, the realm of non-arising, and so on.

original: chos kyi dbyings skye bar mi mthong 'gag par mi mthong zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings skye bar mi mthong 'gag par mi mthong zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe realm of phenomena‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúdoes not see arising, does not see ceasing.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i bzod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bzod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva great being who has such patience,

original: 'di la de lta bu'i bzod pa'i ngo bo yod pas de lta bu'i bzod pa can no //
analyzed: 'di la de lta bu'i bzod pa'i ngo bo yod pas de lta bu'i bzod pa can no //
translated: Here, he has such patience as his nature, so he has such patience.

original: yang gi sgras sngar smos pa'i bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi 'on kyang de lta bu'i bzod pa can yang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras sngar smos pa'i bkod pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi 'on kyang de lta bu'i bzod pa can yang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only does he obtain the samadhi of single array mentioned previously, but also one who has such patience will quickly fully awaken.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the patience that arises from reflection,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gang yang mi sems pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la mi sems pa'i rigs kyi bu de bzod pa lta bu can dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gang yang mi sems pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la mi sems pa'i rigs kyi bu de bzod pa lta bu can dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: the sutra says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, that which is patience is the non-reflection on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and the non-reflection on the bodhisattva dharmas.‚Äù

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is primary.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gang yang mi sems pa ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gang yang mi sems pa ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: He does not think about the result, which is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, because all dharmas are unborn.

original: bsam par bya ba dang sems par byed pa dang / sems pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba dang sems par byed pa dang / sems pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not apprehend anything that is to be thought about, anyone who is thinking, or any thoughts.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The dharmas of bodhisattvas are the perfections, the immeasurables, and so on, which are the causes of perfect enlightenment.

original: de la gang yang mi sems pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang yang mi sems pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: He does not think about any of them.üîΩHe is patient with regard to the cause and the result.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa la mi sems pa'i ngang tshul can de lta bu de ni bsams pa las byung ba'i bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa la mi sems pa'i ngang tshul can de lta bu de ni bsams pa las byung ba'i bzod pa yin te /
translated: Such a person is patient with regard to what is thought about.

original: myur du @80b mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: myur du @80b mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: He will quickly attain manifest, perfect buddhahood.

original: bsgoms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir byang chub ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir thob par byed pa nyid ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa bstan pa'i phyir byang chub ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir thob par byed pa nyid ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate the acceptance that is in harmony with meditation, it says, ‚ÄúEnlightenment is not attained for the sake of buddhahood.‚Äù

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /üîΩbstan zin pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te / bstan zin pa'i mtshan nyid byang chub ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the sake of emphasis.üîΩEnlightenment, which has been explained to have the characteristic of the non-apprehension of all dharmas, is not attained for the sake of buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo'i phyir thob par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo'i phyir thob par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not attained for the sake of the essence of buddhahood.

original: de lta bu yang bzod pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang bzod pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the acceptance that is in harmony with meditation.

original: rigs kyi bu de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur bar brjod do zhes 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur bar brjod do zhes 'byung ba la /
translated: It is said that the son of good lineage will quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.üîΩThis is the acceptance that is in harmony with meditation.

original: de lta bu yang bsgoms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa 'di yin te zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang bsgoms pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa 'di yin te zhes sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the acceptance that is in harmony with meditation.

original: gang zhes bya ba dang de zhes bya ba ni rtag tu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba dang de zhes bya ba ni rtag tu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the acceptance that is in harmony with hearing.

original: rigs kyi bu de ni myur zhing mgyogs par brjod do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ni myur zhing mgyogs par brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe son of good lineage‚Äù refers to the bodhisattva.üîΩ‚ÄúWill quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment‚Äù means that he will quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù means that it is said by the TathƒÅgata.

original: lung ston to //
analyzed: lung ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe will be prophesied‚Äù means that he will be prophesied by the TathƒÅgata.

original: yul gang du myur zhes de'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gang du myur zhes de'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, in what place?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: will become unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: don de lta bu la mos pa dang / zhum pa med pa yang byang chub par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de lta bu la mos pa dang / zhum pa med pa yang byang chub par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that kind of meaning, and in order to demonstrate that one who is not discouraged will become awakened,

original: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes su de ltar mos shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes su de ltar mos shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, All phenomena are the phenomena of the Buddha. One who has faith in that way...

original: chos thams cad ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos so //
translated: All phenomena are the phenomena of ordinary beings and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the Buddha are the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: su de ltar tha dad pa med pa nyid du mos shing zhum par mi 'gyur sems dman par mi 'gyur ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par nges par 'gro bar ngas bshad de ;
analyzed: su de ltar tha dad pa med pa nyid du mos shing zhum par mi 'gyur sems dman par mi 'gyur ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par nges par 'gro bar ngas bshad de ;
translated: One who has faith in that way, who is not discouraged, whose mind is not inferior, I explain that one will definitely go to irreversibility from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de'i sa bon mos pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sa bon mos pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of possessing the seed of faith in that way.

original: gang gis bstan pa 'di'i don thos nas rmongs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis bstan pa 'di'i don thos nas rmongs par mi 'gyur /
translated: Whoever hears the meaning of this teaching and is not confused,

original: gti mug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gti mug par mi 'gyur /
translated: and does not become deluded,

original: yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za zhing so ma nyi za bar mi 'gyur ba de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang mi 'bral zhing ldan par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom za zhing so ma nyi za bar mi 'gyur ba de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang mi 'bral zhing ldan par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and does not doubt, wondering whether it is so or not, should be said to be inseparable from and endowed with all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod pas yang dag par byang chub pa 'thob par de skad ces bka' stsal te bstan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod pas yang dag par byang chub pa 'thob par de skad ces bka' stsal te bstan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par rnam par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus it was said and taught that the attainment of perfect enlightenment is through the practice of the perfection of wisdom and the practice of concentration, and in order to dispel conceptual thoughts about the ultimate nature of cause and effect,

original: bcom ldan 'das myur du bla na med pa @81a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das myur du bla na med pa @81a * //
translated: the Blessed One was asked, What is the cause of quickly attaining the unsurpassed

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: perfect complete enlightenment? and so on.

original: 'jam dpal de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, that is not so, and so on is the answer.

original: byang chub la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bkag pa yin no //
translated: The cause and effect of enlightenment are negated.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhan zhes dogs pa la 'dir 'chad pa ni skye ba med pa dang ; dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩskye ba med pa 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhan zhes dogs pa la 'dir 'chad pa ni skye ba med pa dang ; dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / skye ba med pa 'am /
translated: Here, the explanation is given beginning with ‚Äúnon-arising and non-entityness are not the cause of any effect.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa ni 'bras bu gang gi yang rgyu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'bras bu gang gi yang rgyu ma yin zhing /
translated: Non-arising and non-entityness are not the cause of any effect.

original: rgyu las nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yang med do //
analyzed: rgyu las nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yang med do //
translated: There is no effect that definitely arises from a cause.

original: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod pas myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, isn‚Äôt it said that one quickly becomes fully enlightened through the conduct of the perfection of wisdom and samƒÅdhi?

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag sgrub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa ni mi rigs so snyam nas /
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag sgrub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa ni mi rigs so snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the cause and effect of accomplishing all the deeds of a buddha are nonexistent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen zhes dris so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen zhes dris so //
translated: Why is that?

original: lan ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan ni chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause all phenomena are non-arisen.‚Äù

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa dang / des shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa 'gro ba zhi ba la sogs pa lta ga la yod ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa dang / des shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang / de'i mdzad pa 'gro ba zhi ba la sogs pa lta ga la yod ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: How could there be the cultivation of serenity and insight, and by that, the purification of buddhahood and its activity of the peace of beings, etc.?

original: 'dis ni don dam pa med pa'i byang chub ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid med pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa med pa'i byang chub ni nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid med pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa mi rigs so //
translated: This means that the enlightenment which does not exist ultimately is not tenable as having a cause and effect, like space, which is without characteristic.

original: 'jam dpal de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,

original: rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: a son of good lineage or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bstan pa 'di thos nas nur bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis bstan pa 'di thos nas nur bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: a daughter of good lineage who, having heard this teaching, does not draw back and so on is the conclusion.

original: 'jam dpal de lta bas na dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ston pas rjes su gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de lta bas na dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ston pas rjes su gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, a monk or nun, or a male or female lay practitioner who, having heard this teaching, does not draw back and so on is the acceptance by the Teacher.

original: zhum par mi 'gyur ba nas nur ba'i bar du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur ba nas nur ba'i bar du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not drawing back up to not shrinking back is the acceptance by the Teacher.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sam nyi za ba dang rmongs par mi 'gyur ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sam nyi za ba dang rmongs par mi 'gyur ba bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes not being disgusted and not being confused.

original: nur bar mi 'gyur ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: nur bar mi 'gyur ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: Not turning back has already been explained.

original: bar du gcod pa 'di dag spangs shing sgrub pa gang dag la /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa 'di dag spangs shing sgrub pa gang dag la /
translated: These are the obstructions.üîΩThe practice of abandoning them is not accomplished without being sustained by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba med par mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba med par mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this, it says,

original: de dag ni nga la skyabs su song ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag ni nga la skyabs su song ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey have gone for refuge to me.‚Äù

original: skyabs su dong ba kho na yin pa de bas na ngas bskyab bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyabs su dong ba kho na yin pa de bas na ngas bskyab bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They have gone for refuge to me alone. Therefore, they are worthy of my protection.

original: de dag ni nga'i rjes su rab tu byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni nga'i rjes su rab tu byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThey have gone forth in my name.‚Äù

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin pa'i phyir /üîΩnga dang 'dra @81b bar rab tu byung ba 'am /
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dra ba'i don yin pa'i phyir / nga dang 'dra @81b bar rab tu byung ba 'am /
translated: The word ‚Äúin‚Äù means ‚Äúlike.‚ÄùüîΩThey have gone forth like me.

original: nga dang 'dra bar byed pa ni rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nga dang 'dra bar byed pa ni rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Or, they have gone forth in order to act like me.

original: de bas na de dag gi ston pa ni nga yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi ston pa ni nga yin te /
translated: Therefore, I am their teacher.

original: de dag ni ngas bstan pa'i snod du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ngas bstan pa'i snod du gyur pa yin te /
translated: These are the vessels for my teaching.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / ston par gyur pas chos nyan pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur pa'i las bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / yongs su smin pa la sogs pa ngas de dag la byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / ston par gyur pas chos nyan pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur pa'i las bskyed par 'gyur ba dang / yongs su smin pa la sogs pa ngas de dag la byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: I have performed the deeds that will bring about their going for refuge, their going forth, their listening to the Dharma as my disciples, their development of the roots of virtue, their maturation, etc.

original: des na de dag la sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: des na de dag la sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the Buddha's acceptance of them is not fruitless.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddha's deeds are not fruitless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya las /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya las /
translated: the Jnanamudrasutra declares:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems bskyed pa bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dmu rgod ma yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems bskyed pa bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dmu rgod ma yin par gsungs so //
translated: The Buddhas declare that the bodhisattvas who have achieved the generation of the thought are not wild.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the bodhisattva trainings,

original: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa der yang 'di nyid la bslab par bya ba kho na yin no zhes gnyi ga nges par gzung ba bstan la /üîΩde la snga mas ni bslab pa gzhan las ldog cing /
analyzed: gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bsgrub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa der yang 'di nyid la bslab par bya ba kho na yin no zhes gnyi ga nges par gzung ba bstan la / de la snga mas ni bslab pa gzhan las ldog cing /
translated: The former passage, ‚ÄúOne should practice just this perfection of wisdom,‚Äù teaches that one should train in just this perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe latter passage, ‚ÄúOne should not train in anything else,‚Äù teaches that one should not train in anything else.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa dang ldan pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa dang ldan pa'i don yin no //
translated: The former passage teaches that one should turn away from other trainings and have the training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba ni yon tan rnams kyis bstan to //üîΩgnyis pa ni bslab pa ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam las dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su 'gro ba ni yon tan rnams kyis bstan to // gnyis pa ni bslab pa ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam las dgongs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the former passage teaches the benefits.

original: ldog pa ni skyon rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩ'jam dpal rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: ldog pa ni skyon rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir / 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: The latter passage teaches the faults, intending that one should turn away from non-training.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mi slob pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mi slob pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, any sons or daughters of good lineage who do not train in this profound perfection of wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi slob pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gsum lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid la mi slob pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi slob pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gsum lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi bdag nyid la mi slob pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which is not a training, is the non-training in the three trainings of the bodhisattva, which have the nature of the six perfections, characterized by superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: bslab pa'i dngos po drug de dag //
analyzed: bslab pa'i dngos po drug de dag //
translated: Those six things to be trained in

original: snga ma snga ma rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma rgyu dag yin //
translated: are the causes of the former ones.üîΩGenerosity, morality, patience,

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab rnams //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod pa dang // brtson 'grus bsam gtan shes rab rnams //
translated: effort, concentration, and wisdom,

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims snga ma gsum //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims snga ma gsum //
translated: The former three are superior morality,

original: brtson 'grus kun tu 'gro bar 'dod //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kun tu 'gro bar 'dod //
translated: effort is considered universal.

original: lhag sems lhag pa'i shes rab ni //
analyzed: lhag sems lhag pa'i shes rab ni //
translated: Superior mind and superior wisdom

original: bsam gtan shes rab go rims bzhin //üîΩbsod @82a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab go rims bzhin // bsod @82a * //
translated: are concentration and wisdom, respectively.

original: nams ye shes tshogs dang ni //
analyzed: nams ye shes tshogs dang ni //
translated: The accumulations of merit and wisdom

original: dang po gsum dang tha ma yin //
analyzed: dang po gsum dang tha ma yin //
translated: are the first three and the last.

original: 'di la kun tu 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: 'di la kun tu 'gro ba ni //
translated: Here, the universal ones

original: bsam gtan brtson 'grus bcas par brjod //
analyzed: bsam gtan brtson 'grus bcas par brjod //
translated: are said to be concentration and effort.

original: sems can rjes su gzung ba dang // nyon mongs gnyen po gsum tshan gnyis //üîΩ'di dag nyid kyi grogs yin phyir//üîΩthabs la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: sems can rjes su gzung ba dang // nyon mongs gnyen po gsum tshan gnyis // 'di dag nyid kyi grogs yin phyir// thabs la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Two sets of three, for taking up sentient beings and for the antidotes to the addictions.üîΩThese are the four kinds of means,

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par ni sbyin pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ldog pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med par ni sbyin pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ldog pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: and so on.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Without the perfection of wisdom, the other perfections are not perfections, because they are blocked, since they generate the superimposition of self.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin na yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa nyid ma yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mi slob na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa len pa'i dbang mdzad pa sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin na yang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa nyid ma yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mi slob na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa len pa'i dbang mdzad pa sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi
translated: And if they are not perfections, they are not even the training of the bodhisattvas. So if one does not train in this perfection of wisdom, one is not engaged in the training of the bodhisattvas.

original: thugs bslus pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i sems can gyi tshogs mtha' med pa dag dbugs phyung ba yang bslus pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs bslus pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i sems can gyi tshogs mtha' med pa dag dbugs phyung ba yang bslus pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The Buddhas and bodhisattvas, who have the power to grant the training of the bodhisattvas, are deceived, and the infinite multitudes of suffering sentient beings are deceived.

original: dpe ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: dpe ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The example is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i chos 'jig rten ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dge ba'i chos 'jig rten ba 'am /
translated: In the same way, all the wholesome dharmas of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, whether mundane or supramundane,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa /
translated: embraced by the perfections,

original: gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad skye ba med pa'i rnam pa goms par bya ste /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad skye ba med pa'i rnam pa goms par bya ste /
translated: should be cultivated in the aspect of non-production.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na /
translated: When embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'phel zhing rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: 'phel zhing rgyas pa ste /
translated: they increase and expand.

original: rgyun 'phel ba dang / yangs pa rgya che ba dang / mi zad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun 'phel ba dang / yangs pa rgya che ba dang / mi zad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: They become an uninterrupted stream, vast and extensive, and inexhaustible.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slu bar mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slu bar mi byed do //
translated: They do not fail to bring about the desired result, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de bas na rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la gus pas bsten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la gus pas bsten par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who desires perfect enlightenment should respectfully rely on the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: smon lam yongs su bzung ba med par dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i bar du med pas na /
analyzed: smon lam yongs su bzung ba med par dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / lhag par mos pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i bar du med pas na /
translated: Since there is no listening to the holy Dharma, no special interest, and no attainment of Buddhahood without the acceptance of the vow,

original: gdul bya rnams smon lam 'debs su gzhug pa'i phyir zhus pa /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams smon lam 'debs su gzhug pa'i phyir zhus pa /
translated: the disciples are urged to make the vow.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa gang lags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa gang lags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúBhagavat, as for the teaching of the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: lan ni 'jam dpal gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di da ltar gyi tshe la thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan ni 'jam dpal gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di da ltar gyi tshe la thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúManjusri, whoever attains this teaching of the perfection of wisdom in this life,‚Äù and so on.

original: da ltar gyi tshe 'di la skye ba med @82b par bstan pa 'di thos nas /üîΩbdag tshe 'di brjes nas kyang /
analyzed: da ltar gyi tshe 'di la skye ba med @82b par bstan pa 'di thos nas / bdag tshe 'di brjes nas kyang /
translated: Having heard this teaching of non-production in this present life,üîΩafter I have passed from this life,

original: tshe 'phos nas tshe gzhan gyi tshe na yang /
analyzed: tshe 'phos nas tshe gzhan gyi tshe na yang /
translated: in the life after this, in another life,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di nyan to zhes smon lam btab pa de dag ni phyis nyan pa nas sgom par byed pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di nyan to zhes smon lam btab pa de dag ni phyis nyan pa nas sgom par byed pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have prayed, ‚ÄúMay I hear this teaching of the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù will later hear it, and so on up to: will practice it.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lhag par mos pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lhag par mos pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates the stage of pure conviction and so on.

original: mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mi sgom pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni mi rtog pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout cultivating‚Äù means without conceptualizing.

original: 'jam dpal gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos te thos pa kho nas kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos te thos pa kho nas kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, those who hear this profound perfection of wisdom, and by merely hearing it, and so on up to:

original: khon zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khon zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äúmerely‚Äù is used to exclude other causes.

original: thos pa kho nas mgu ba yangs pa thob pa ni yid bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa kho nas mgu ba yangs pa thob pa ni yid bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will attain joy‚Äù means they will attain mental satisfaction.

original: dga' ba yid dga' ba gzengs mtho ba thob pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung bar nga mi 'chad do //
analyzed: dga' ba yid dga' ba gzengs mtho ba thob pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung bar nga mi 'chad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will attain delight, mental satisfaction, and elation‚Äù means they will attain mental satisfaction. ‚ÄúI do not say that they have small wholesome roots.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa bstan zin to //
translated: The practice of the perfection of wisdom has been taught.

original: dbang po rnon po'i gang zag mngon du 'ongs pa'i dbang du byas pa rdzogs nas /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i gang zag mngon du 'ongs pa'i dbang du byas pa rdzogs nas /
translated: The section for the person of sharp faculties who has actually arrived is complete.

original: da ni gang zag dbang po rnon po ma yin pa dang / de'i tshe mngon du 'ongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: da ni gang zag dbang po rnon po ma yin pa dang / de'i tshe mngon du 'ongs pa ma yin la /
translated: Now, for the person who is not of sharp faculties and who has not actually arrived at that time,

original: rgyu rkyen 'ga' zhig gi dbang gis skal ba yod pa tsam du zad pa de'i ched du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen 'ga' zhig gi dbang gis skal ba yod pa tsam du zad pa de'i ched du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but who merely has the good fortune due to the power of some causes and conditions, in order to show the example of the non-conceptual image which is the domain of samƒÅdhi for that person,

original: 'jam dpal gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la nyan 'dod par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di la nyan 'dod par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, whoever wishes to listen to this teaching of the perfection of wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni sngar gang gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa de 'jug pa'i snga ma de nyid las 'di phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba'i sgras ni sngar gang gi dbang du byas nas bshad pa de 'jug pa'i snga ma de nyid las 'di phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhoever‚Äù refers to the one for whose benefit the explanation was given earlier. This is distinguished and taught from the previous one.

original: 'di la nyan 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la nyan 'dod par gyur na /
translated: If one wishes to listen to this,

original: thos pa don du gnyer na des 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thos pa don du gnyer na des 'og nas 'byung ba 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: if one seeks to hear it, then one should say what is stated below.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: rigs kyi bu khyod de mnyan pas ci zhig bya zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod de mnyan pas ci zhig bya zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, what will you do by listening to it?‚Äù

original: khyod bstan pa 'di thos nas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: khyod bstan pa 'di thos nas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the purpose of your listening to this teaching?

original: 'dir mnyan par gong nas gong du 'dun pa bskyed pa'i don du spong ba'i tshig yin gyi spang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no//
analyzed: 'dir mnyan par gong nas gong du 'dun pa bskyed pa'i don du spong ba'i tshig yin gyi spang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no//
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúabandon‚Äù has the sense of generating ever-greater interest in listening, not the sense of abandoning it.

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason,

original: thos nas ma dad cing phyir nur ta re zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thos nas ma dad cing phyir nur ta re zhes gsungs te /

original: yid ches par ma nus te /
analyzed: yid ches par ma nus te /
translated: You will be unable to have confidence.

original: phyir nur cing sems zhum par gyur ta re shes rab nyam chung ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir nur cing sems zhum par gyur ta re shes rab nyam chung ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang shes rab rnon po ma yin pa nyan par 'dod pa'i dad @83a * //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang shes rab rnon po ma yin pa nyan par 'dod pa'i dad @83a * //
translated: Another alternative is that you will not listen with sharp wisdom, but with faith that desires to listen.

original: pa lhag par yod pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa 'di la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / rjes su mthun par nyan par 'dod pa yod srid de /üîΩde la rigs kyi bu khyod de mnyan pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa de skad du brjod par bya ste /üîΩzab mo'i tshul bstan pa 'di lta bu de las bkar te /üîΩde dang rjes su mthun par rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dpes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa lhag par yod pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dmigs pa'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa 'di la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / rjes su mthun par nyan par 'dod pa yod srid de / de la rigs kyi bu khyod de mnyan pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa de skad du brjod par bya ste / zab mo'i tshul bstan pa 'di lta bu de las bkar te / de dang rjes su mthun par rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dpes rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who have a special interest in the perfection of wisdom, the nature of the determination of the aspects of the objective supports of the factors of enlightenment, may be persons who follow the teachings and wish to listen in accordance with this teaching on the nature of the determination of the aspects of the objective supports of the factors of enlightenment.üîΩTo them, one should say such things as, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, what would you do by listening to that?‚ÄùüîΩHaving been excluded from this kind of teaching on the profound mode,üîΩone should understand it through analogies that are in accordance with it, through nonconceptual representations.

analyzed: spobs pa'i phyag rgya 'di la gnas pa de la slad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar 'di bstan par mi bgyi'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: This seal of eloquence should be placed in this perfection of wisdom, and later on, this non-production, non-existence, and non-arising of the perfection of wisdom should not be taught.

original: snod du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snod du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that having made them into vessels.

original: ci'i phyir ma dad pa gang yin ba nur bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma dad pa gang yin ba nur bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that those who lack faith will turn away?

original: de'i phyir / 'di la chos gang yang yongs su grub par ma bstan te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la chos gang yang yongs su grub par ma bstan te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúHere, any dharma is not taught as fully established.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bsdus pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is a summary statement.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams skye ba 'am 'jig par yang ma bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par yin te rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams skye ba 'am 'jig par yang ma bstan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par yin te rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe dharmas of ordinary beings are not taught as arising or ceasing‚Äù and so on is an elaboration, and is easy to understand.

analyzed: de ltar bstan pa dang don de la dbang po rtul po de dag snod du gyur par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i rim pa ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das dge slong ngam /
translated: Thus, in order to make those of dull faculties who are taught in that way into vessels, the stages of engagement are taught: ‚ÄúBlessed One, a monk or nun, or a male or female lay person, who has faith in this perfection of wisdom, and who is not lacking in perfect confidence, should be known as a beginner in the vehicle.‚Äù

original: dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'am /

translated: or a male or female lay practitioner, should say to me, ‚ÄòVenerableüîΩSubh≈´ti, the Blessed One has declared you to be foremost amongüîΩthose who abide in the freedom from attachment.

original: chos kyi gtam mdzad pa de dag yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo 'di gtam ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gtam mdzad pa de dag yin no zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rang gi ngo bo 'di gtam ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de skad du 'dri ba de la bdag gis 'di skad du /
translated: I should reply, ‚ÄòThe Dharma discourse that I have been expounding isüîΩthe one that does not contradict any phenomenon.‚ÄôüîΩBecause it generatesüîΩinterest in those who aspire to the Dharma that does not contradict

original: chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba'i gtam mo zhes brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba'i chos la mngon par 'dod pa rnams dang pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskye ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos ni gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba'i gtam mo zhes brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba'i chos la mngon par 'dod pa rnams dang pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro // skye ba med pa dang 'gal ba'i chos ni gang yang yod pa ma yin pa de ni de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: any phenomenon.üîΩThere is no phenomenon that contradicts the absence of arising.üîΩThat is the way things really are, because all phenomena are

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: unproduced.üîΩThat discourse is independent, of the nature of permanence, and

original: bka' mchid de ni rang dbang can rtag pa'i ngo bo bdag la @83b sogs pa 'am /
analyzed: bka' mchid de ni rang dbang can rtag pa'i ngo bo bdag la @83b sogs pa 'am /
translated: belongs to me and others.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sems can gang gis kyang 'tshal bar sla ba ma lags so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sems can gang gis kyang 'tshal bar sla ba ma lags so //

original: 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gang yang dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //

original: don de la bzod par byas nas /
analyzed: don de la bzod par byas nas /

analyzed: de ltar bzod par gyur pa dang ; de la bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan du'o //

analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni phyis de la 'di skad du mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de bstan par gyur to zhes brjod par bgyi'o //
translated: And there, one should say, ‚ÄòLater, that non-arising was taught as a phenomenon there.‚Äô

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the reason,

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni skye ba ma mchis par mnyam pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni skye ba ma mchis par mnyam pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄòBecause all phenomena are the same in being non-arisen.‚Äô

original: ji ltar de skad du brjod /
analyzed: ji ltar de skad du brjod /
translated: How is it said in this way?

original: 'di ltar gtam des dgra bcom pa thob par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtam des dgra bcom pa thob par byed cing /
translated: Because by that teaching, the state of an arhat is attained,

original: so so'i skye bo nyid 'jig par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid 'jig par byed pa yin te /
translated: and the state of an ordinary being is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar skye ba med par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar skye ba med par chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin zhe na /

original: de'i phyir bka' mchid der ni dgra bcom pa rnams gang ma rtogs pa ma bstan la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bka' mchid der ni dgra bcom pa rnams gang ma rtogs pa ma bstan la /
translated: In that discourse, the arhats did not teach what they had not realized.

original: dgra bcom pa'i chos kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos de dag ji ltar yang mi 'jig go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i chos kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos de dag ji ltar yang mi 'jig go zhes gsungs te /
translated: And the arhats‚Äô qualities do not in any way destroy the qualities of ordinary beings.

original: dgra bcom pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi yin pas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi yin pas /
translated: The characteristics of arhats are general,

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bya ste /
translated: so they apply to ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: de dag gi gong ma rtogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa ma bstan ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gi gong ma rtogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa ma bstan ma gsungs te /
translated: The discourse did not teach or say that they have attained the supramundane gnosis that is superior to that.

original: rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa med par gsungs so //
translated: It says that they do not have perfect realization.

original: dgra bcom pa'i chos kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i chos kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag skye ba med pa la sogs pa yin pas /
translated: And the arhats‚Äô qualities do not in any way destroy the qualities of ordinary beings, such as attachment, because those qualities of ordinary beings‚Äîattachment and so on‚Äîare unborn and so forth.

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis kyang bshig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis kyang bshig pa ma yin no //
