original: de dag gis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: These passages demonstrate the absence of perfect abandonment.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i chos skye ba med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i chos skye ba med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the non-arising of the apprehended object,

original: 'dzin pa skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the non-arising of the apprehender,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang de la bdag gis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang de la bdag gis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMoreover, BhagavƒÅn, I would say this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: don de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: don de ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of that has already been explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bdag las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bdag las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMoreover, I wish to listen to this profound perfection of wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nyan par nus pa'i phyir snod du @84a * //üîΩgyur pa dang / gang zhig 'di nyan pa'i ched du gzhan yang 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa nyan par nus pa'i phyir snod du @84a * // gyur pa dang / gang zhig 'di nyan pa'i ched du gzhan yang 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover‚Äù means that, because one is able to listen to non-arising, one becomes a suitable vessel, and one who asks others in order to listen to this.

original: 'dri ba de la dris pa bzhin mi 'chad par gzhan du de la bdag gis 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'dri ba de la dris pa bzhin mi 'chad par gzhan du de la bdag gis 'di skad du /
translated: To that questioner, without explaining it as asked, one should say to them,üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti, if a son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to listen to this perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, and having listened, were to believe it, and having believed it, were to memorize it, and having memorized it, were to study it, and having studied it, were to be consecrated, and having been consecrated, were to teach it, and having taught it, were to practice it, and having practiced it, were to penetrate it, and having penetrated it, were to teach it extensively to others, then that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would create a lot of merit.‚Äù

original: gal te khyod nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid ma gtod cig ces pa bshad de /
analyzed: gal te khyod nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid ma gtod cig ces pa bshad de /
translated: If you wish to listen, do not focus your mind thinking, ‚ÄúI will listen.‚ÄùüîΩDo not focus your mind in a mental process; do not make an effort thinking, ‚ÄúI will listen.‚Äù

original: yid mngon bar 'du byed pa ma gtod cig / mnyan par bya'o snyam du rtsol ba dang bcas pa ma byed cig / gtan tshigs des na mnyan to snyam du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par ma bskyed cig / de ltar rgyu dang
analyzed: yid mngon bar 'du byed pa ma gtod cig / mnyan par bya'o snyam du rtsol ba dang bcas pa ma byed cig / gtan tshigs des na mnyan to snyam du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa de'i rnam par ma bskyed cig / de ltar rgyu dang
translated: For that reason, do not generate the aspect of that mind, mentality, and consciousness thinking, ‚ÄúI will listen.‚Äù

original: bcas pa'i nyan pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba bsal du zin kyang /
analyzed: bcas pa'i nyan pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba bsal du zin kyang /
translated: Although the arising of the conceptual thought of listening with its causeüîΩhas been eliminated in that way,

original: rnam pa de tsam gyis cha shas bsal bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rnam pa de tsam gyis cha shas bsal bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: that much aspect is not eliminated.

original: dpe gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the two examples,

original: kye skyes bu sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kye skyes bu sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúOh man, what is the wisdom of an illusory man?‚Äù and so on.

original: sgyu mas byas pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu yin gyi /
analyzed: sgyu mas byas pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu yin gyi /
translated: An illusory person is an illusory man,

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po ni ma yin te /
translated: not an illusionist.

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / brgyad stong pa dang / nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / brgyad stong pa dang / nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it is non-conceptual, and because it contradicts the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, and so on.

original: de las ni 'di ltar dpe 'di gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de las ni 'di ltar dpe 'di gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: In this regard, the example is clarified in that sutra:

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni 'di snyam du sgyu ma'i mkhan po ni bdag dang nye'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ni 'di snyam du sgyu ma'i mkhan po ni bdag dang nye'o //
translated: The illusory person does not think, ‚ÄúThe magician is near to me.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skye bo'i tshogs ni bdag dang ring ngo snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skye bo'i tshogs ni bdag dang ring ngo snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The crowd of people other than him are far from me.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la shes rab ga la yod ce na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la shes rab ga la yod ce na /
translated: How can there be wisdom in an illusory person?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: med pa dang / 'dra ba'i shes rab bskyed par bya ba 'di nyid 'dir dpe'i don yin te /
analyzed: med pa dang / 'dra ba'i shes rab bskyed par bya ba 'di nyid 'dir dpe'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning of the example here is to generate wisdom that is non-existent and similar to that.

original: de lta bu yin na ni chos bshad pa 'di shes par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yin na ni chos bshad pa 'di shes par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were like that, this explanation of the Dharma would be possible, but not otherwise.

original: ji ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du chung zad kyang shes ba med na ni de lta na 'dir shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ltar na 'di ni dmigs pa med pa nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du chung zad kyang shes ba med na ni de lta na 'dir shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de ltar na 'di ni dmigs pa med pa nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this should be understood as the teaching of the absence of an object.

original: rnam pa gang gis de ltar bya ba yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis de ltar bya ba yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach by what mode it is so,

original: dpe gnyis pa kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe gnyis pa kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir /
translated: the second example is given: ‚ÄúO son of noble family, if you wish to listen to this teaching of the Dharma, then

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: in this way, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha' la bya gnas pa lta bur gnas par gyis shig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bya gnas pa lta bur gnas par gyis shig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: you should abide like a bird in the sky.‚Äù

original: bya ni 'dab chags so //
analyzed: bya ni 'dab chags so //
translated: A bird is a winged creature.

original: gnas pa ni 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dug pa ste /
translated: Abiding is sitting.

original: gang la 'ang brten cing dmigs pa dang / gang du yang @84b chags pa med pa de ni de'i gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'ang brten cing dmigs pa dang / gang du yang @84b chags pa med pa de ni de'i gnas pa yin no //
translated: That which is not dependent on or objectifying anything, and is not attached to anything, is its abiding.

original: khyod kyang de ltar gnas shing blo chags pa med pa yin na ni 'chad cing 'di la nyan pa 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don 'di mnyan par nus so //
analyzed: khyod kyang de ltar gnas shing blo chags pa med pa yin na ni 'chad cing 'di la nyan pa 'di lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don 'di mnyan par nus so //
translated: You too, if you abide thus, without attachment, you will be able to listen to this teaching, up to this listening.

original: de bas na mnyan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mnyan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, listen!

original: de ltar gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is that abiding?

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that intended meaning, [the BhagavƒÅn] says,

original: kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir /
analyzed: kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na de'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúO man, if you wish to listen to this teaching on the Dharma, then

original: de bas na gnyis la ma dmigs shig / gnyis med pa la yang ma gnas shig zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis la ma dmigs shig / gnyis med pa la yang ma gnas shig zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, do not focus on duality, and do not abide in non-duality.

original: gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ste /
translated: Duality is cause and effect.

original: 'dus byas la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas la bya'o //
translated: [It] refers to the conditioned.

original: gnyis med pa ni 'dus ma byas la bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni 'dus ma byas la bya ste /
translated: Non-duality refers to the unconditioned,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis yang dag par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis yang dag par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two, cause and effect, are not truly produced.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Others say: Duality is the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gnyis med pa ni de dag stong pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni de dag stong pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: Non-duality is the emptiness of those two.

original: de la dmigs shing de'i rnam pa can gyi sems kyis 'di dag rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes sgro 'dogs par byed na yang /
analyzed: de la dmigs shing de'i rnam pa can gyi sems kyis 'di dag rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes sgro 'dogs par byed na yang /
translated: If, observing that, the mind that has its aspect superimposes, ‚ÄúThese are mere representations,‚Äù

original: sems rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: then it does not abide in the suchness of the mind that is a representation.

original: ci'i phyir dmigs par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not observe it?

original: de'i phyir 'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúHere, there is no expression of the duality that is expressed,‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyis sam gnyis med pa gang yang dmigs pa nyid du brjod cing bstan par byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis sam gnyis med pa gang yang dmigs pa nyid du brjod cing bstan par byas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no expression or teaching of either duality or nonduality as an object.

original: gal te chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to listen to this teaching of the Dharma,

original: bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma gzhig shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni bdag tu 'du shes la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa rnams la gzhig pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma gzhig shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni bdag tu 'du shes la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa rnams la gzhig pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not destroy the perception of self,‚Äù and so on, is said because it is not reasonable to destroy the perception of self and so on, which are intrinsically unarisen.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang zhig bdag las nyan par 'tshal te 'dri na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thal zin pa rnams mjug sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang zhig bdag las nyan par 'tshal te 'dri na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thal zin pa rnams mjug sdud pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, if someone wishes to listen to me and asks questions,

original: de la bdag gis gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyi rim pa de skad brjod par bgyi'o //üîΩde skad bshad cing ;
analyzed: de la bdag gis gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyi rim pa de skad brjod par bgyi'o // de skad bshad cing ;
translated: I will speak in that way, in the sequence of the method that I have taught above.üîΩI will explain in that way,

original: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will teach in that way.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o //
translated: I will establish them in this reflection on the object of non-conceptual samƒÅdhi.

original: gdams pa rjes su bstan pa tsam la gzhag pa nyid kyis ni gdul bya dbang po rtul po yin par yang bstan to //üîΩgal te 'dri ba'i rigs @85a * //
analyzed: gdams pa rjes su bstan pa tsam la gzhag pa nyid kyis ni gdul bya dbang po rtul po yin par yang bstan to // gal te 'dri ba'i rigs @85a * //
translated: By merely establishing them in instruction and teaching, it is also shown that the disciples are of dull faculties.

original: kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: kyi bu 'am /
translated: If a son or daughter of good family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo ji skad du bstan pa'i dpe gnyis lta bu la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo ji skad du bstan pa'i dpe gnyis lta bu la /
translated: like the two examples as taught,

original: de ltar gnas shing /
analyzed: de ltar gnas shing /
translated: dwells in that way,

original: de ltar zhugs te /üîΩdga' bar byed na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs te / dga' bar byed na zhes bya ste /
translated: engages in that way,üîΩand delights in that way,

original: dga' ba ni chags pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni chags pa yin par bshad do //
translated: delight is explained as attachment.

original: glegs bam kha cig las rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: In some texts, it says, ‚ÄúO son or daughter of good family, if one abides in that way and is not frightened by that‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing de ltar mi skrag na zhes 'byung ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing de ltar mi skrag na zhes 'byung ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: 'dri ba de ltar gnas shing mi skrag ste /
analyzed: 'dri ba de ltar gnas shing mi skrag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf one abides in that way and is not frightened by that question,

original: 'dri ba yongs su spong bar mi byed na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba yongs su spong bar mi byed na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and does not abandon the question, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: sngar 'byung ba ltar bzang ngo //
analyzed: sngar 'byung ba ltar bzang ngo //
translated: It is good as it appears earlier.

original: de'i spobs pa ni khong du chud pa dang rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spobs pa ni khong du chud pa dang rtogs pa'o //
translated: His confidence is understanding and realization.

original: de nyid phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: de nyid phyag rgya yin te /
translated: That itself is the seal.

original: gong nas gong du rgyas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i snod nyid du rung ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: gong nas gong du rgyas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i snod nyid du rung ba'i rtags so //
translated: It is a sign of being a suitable vessel for the explanation of the perfection of wisdom in greater and greater detail.

original: 'di la gnas pa ni yod cing thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni yod cing thob pa'o //
translated: One who abides in that has it and has attained it.

original: de nas slad kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar sngar ji ltar bstan pa bzhin rim gyis ji ltar bzod par bstan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de nas slad kyis mchog tu gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma skyes pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar sngar ji ltar bstan pa bzhin rim gyis ji ltar bzod par bstan par bgyi'o //
translated: Then later, the supreme perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, non-existent, and non-arisen, should be gradually taught as it was previously explained, up to the point of acceptance.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis ni dpe dang 'dres //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni dpe dang 'dres //
translated: By nature, he is like an example.

original: 'jig pa dman pa'i skye bo la //
analyzed: 'jig pa dman pa'i skye bo la //
translated: For the inferior person who is destroyed,

original: 'gro la phan byed mthar gyis 'dul //
analyzed: 'gro la phan byed mthar gyis 'dul //
translated: he gradually tames the world,

original: glang po che dag slong ba bzhin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: glang po che dag slong ba bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: like a trainer of elephants.

original: de la slad kyis zhes bya ba ni dus phyis so //
analyzed: de la slad kyis zhes bya ba ni dus phyis so //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúlater‚Äù means at a later time.

original: mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nges par mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nges par mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving become supreme‚Äù means having become definitely supreme.

original: de ltar gdul bya'i thabs la mkhas pas bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas legs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar gdul bya'i thabs la mkhas pas bcom ldan 'das dgyes nas legs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn, having become pleased with the skill in means of the trainees, said ‚ÄúExcellent!‚Äù

original: rjes su gnang ba yang mdzad do //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba yang mdzad do //
translated: and also gave his approval.

original: rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúTo that son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad kyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'i don de la gus pa dang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad kyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'i don de la gus pa dang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: daughter of a good family, later say this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth is for the sake of generating respect and enthusiasm for the meaning that is explained.

original: sngar bshad pa las 'di'i 'bras bu tha dad par gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa las 'di'i 'bras bu tha dad par gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of this is not different from what was explained previously,

original: sgom pa gnyi ga yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgom pa gnyi ga yang skye ba med pa'i ngo bor gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both cultivations are the same in being of the nature of non-arising.

original: 'on kyang gdul bya la ltos nas snga ma ni rgyas pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdul bya la ltos nas snga ma ni rgyas pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: However, in relation to the disciples, the former is more extensive.

original: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bsdus pa tsam du zad do //
translated: This is merely a brief summary.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug @85b go ;
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug @85b go ;
translated: Therein, by means of the various manifestations of the Buddha and Bodhisattva miracles, etc., beings are caused to generate the Mind of Enlightenment in accordance with the cause.

original: / sems bskyed pa de yang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir /
analyzed: / sems bskyed pa de yang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir /
translated: And that generation of the Mind is for the sake of the benefit of others.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the very desire for perfect enlightenment.

original: de yang de dag gi 'dod par bya ba'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang de dag gi 'dod par bya ba'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: And that is the perfect result of their desire.

original: de bas na de de ltar 'dus ma byas la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing goms par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de de ltar 'dus ma byas la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing goms par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that one accomplishes that by means of the method of application to the unconditioned, i.e., by training in and becoming accustomed to the perfection of wisdom, he says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you wish to see the Tathagata, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na /
translated: If you meditate on this perfection of wisdom by way of not meditating,üîΩyou will see the Tathagata, and you will serve him by training in the way of nonapprehending, and the Tathagata will become your teacher by training in the way of nonproduction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur ba ni ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul du slob pas bsnyen bkur byas pa yin pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul du slob pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa por 'gyur ba dag / sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba bshad pa las bdag gis sngar ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur ba ni ji ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul du slob pas bsnyen bkur byas pa yin pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul du slob pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa por 'gyur ba dag / sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gzung ba bshad pa las bdag gis sngar ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: The Buddha's acceptance of you should be understood as I have explained it above.

original: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par byang chub par gyur na /
analyzed: / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mngon par byang chub par gyur na /
translated: If you wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, etc.

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang / mchod pa bkod pa dang / bdud las rgyal ba la sogs pa khyad par du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das mthong nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang / mchod pa bkod pa dang / bdud las rgyal ba la sogs pa khyad par du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das mthong nas /
translated: Having seen the special Bhagavat, with the adornments of the site of enlightenment, the array of offerings, the victory over Mara, etc.,

original: de lta bur gyur par shog shig ces skal ba dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur par shog shig ces skal ba dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig sems skyed par byed do //
translated: some fortunate one generates the thought, ‚ÄúMay I become just like that!‚Äù

original: de ltar na bdud 'dul ba la sogs pa ston par 'dod pa zhes thams cad du de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bdud 'dul ba la sogs pa ston par 'dod pa zhes thams cad du de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should always add ‚Äúin order to demonstrate‚Äù to the subjugation of Mara, etc.

original: 'phros par dogs pa'i phyir ma smras so //
analyzed: 'phros par dogs pa'i phyir ma smras so //
translated: I have not said it because I fear prolixity.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub de yang de la 'dod pa rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i tshul du bslabs pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub de yang de la 'dod pa rnams kyis mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i tshul du bslabs pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that perfect enlightenment is accomplished by those who desire it through training in the manner of non-conditioning.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa bsgrub pa yang ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis goms par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa bsgrub pa yang ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul gyis goms par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the accomplishment of skill in all meditative stabilizations is accomplished through familiarization in the manner of non-production, non-entity, and non-arising.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la thug pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la thug pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the highest of all aspects refers to the aspects of the factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables, etc., up to the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa de dag mchog yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag mchog yin zhing /
translated: Those aspects are the highest

original: 'dod par bya ba @86a * //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba @86a * //
translated: because they are to be desired.

original: yin pas dam pa ste /
analyzed: yin pas dam pa ste /
translated: They are supreme

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are extremely pure.

original: de dang de dag dang ldan pa de bsgrub par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de dang de dag dang ldan pa de bsgrub par 'dod pas /
translated: One who wishes to accomplish that which is endowed with those aspects

original: 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid la mi bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bsgoms na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: will succeed if one meditates on it by way of not meditating.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras de las gzhan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'dod na /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras de las gzhan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes for the other qualities of a Tathagata besides those,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will succeed by being habituated to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pas ci'i phyir dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i tshul du bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pas ci'i phyir dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i tshul du bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to see a Tathagata, etc., why should one meditate by way of the non-existence of things, etc.?

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes kyi bar 'di thams cad 'dus ma byas pa dang / skye ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / ye shes kyi bar 'di thams cad 'dus ma byas pa dang / skye ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the TathƒÅgata, enlightenment, meditative absorption, and wisdom up to here are all unconditioned and unarisen.

original: de bas na de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should cultivate in this way.

original: chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ste zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: All phenomena are associated with deliverance means that they are associated with deliverance.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ma bcings pa'o //
translated: Because they are naturally completely passed beyond sorrow, they are not bound.

original: gang nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya bas ni khyab pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang nges par mi 'byung ba'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya bas ni khyab pa bstan pa'o //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is not associated with deliverance means that the pervasion is taught.

original: de ltar shes par 'dod pas 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes par 'dod pas 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to understand this should train in just this.

original: bar gyi sgras skye ba med pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: bar gyi sgras skye ba med pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The intermediate term includes non-arising, and so on.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshul du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshul du sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied in the manner of non-entityness.

original: chos thams cad ni nges par mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nges par mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena are not associated with deliverance means that

original: nges par 'byung ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba med pa yin te /
translated: There is no one who does not go forth.

original: ma skyes pa rnams ni nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams ni nges par 'byung ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not tenable that those who have not been born go forth, as before.

original: sems can thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa ste /
translated: All sentient beings practice for the sake of enlightenment.

original: gang byang chub kyi phyir mi spyod pa'i sems can de gang yang med do zhes bya bas khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi phyir mi spyod pa'i sems can de gang yang med do zhes bya bas khyab pa bstan to //
translated: There is no sentient being whatsoever who does not practice for the sake of enlightenment.üîΩThus, the pervasion is shown.

original: de la zhum pa med par 'dod pas kyang dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhum pa med par 'dod pas kyang dngos po med pa'i bar gyi tshul gyis 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to be without discouragement should train in this very [practice] by way of the method up to the non-existence of things.

original: sems can thams cad byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa'i don 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa'i don 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of all sentient beings practicing for the sake of enlightenment is as before.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams byang chub kyi ched du spyod pa yin par rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams byang chub kyi ched du spyod pa yin par rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that? How should one understand that those in the hells and so forth practice for the sake of enlightenment?

original: gtan tshigs su 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reason is stated: ‚ÄúBecause all phenomena are the same as awakening.‚Äù

original: @86b gang gi phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: @86b gang gi phyir chos thams cad ma skyes pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because all phenomena are unborn,

original: chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are the same as awakening.

original: 'dis ni spyod pa'i yul dang / byang chub mnyam par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa'i yul dang / byang chub mnyam par bstan to //
translated: This shows the equality of the domain of experience and awakening.

original: spyod par byed pa dang / spyod pa dang / byang chub rnams dbyer med par tshig 'og mas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod par byed pa dang / spyod pa dang / byang chub rnams dbyer med par tshig 'og mas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The next verse shows that the one who experiences, the experience, and awakening are inseparable:

original: ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as all phenomena are the same as awakening,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar byang chub ma skyes pa de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub ma skyes pa de bzhin du sems can rnams kyang ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Just as awakening is unborn, so too are sentient beings unborn.

original: sems can thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as all sentient beings are,

original: spyod pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: spyod pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: so too is experience.

original: ma skyes pa de dag la spyod pa lta ga la yod ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa de dag la spyod pa lta ga la yod ;
translated: How could there be any experience of those who are unborn?

original: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúthere is none.‚Äù

original: spyod pa ni byang chub dang mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyod pa ni byang chub dang mnyam pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The conduct is equal to enlightenment.

original: des na so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all the conduct of ordinary beings, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so forth is non-conduct.

original: spyod pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Conduct is engagement.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: That which has that is a practitioner.

original: de med pa'i phyir spyod par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir spyod par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no practitioner.

original: spyod par byed pa med na yang spyod pa ga la yod /
analyzed: spyod par byed pa med na yang spyod pa ga la yod /
translated: If there is no practitioner, how can there be conduct?

original: spyod pa de nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: spyod pa de nyid byang chub ste /
translated: That very conduct is enlightenment.

original: byang chub gang yin pa skye ba med pa'ang de yin /
analyzed: byang chub gang yin pa skye ba med pa'ang de yin /
translated: That which is enlightenment is also non-arising.

original: 'byung ba med pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa yang de yin no //
translated: It is also non-origination.

original: dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi don rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi don rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meanings of unconditioned things such as non-entity and so forth should also be seen.

original: 'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, that which is called the emanations of the TathƒÅgata and so forth is stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa byed pa ste /
translated: The magical emanations of the Tathagata are the creation of roots of virtue in the mindstreams of those to be trained, etc.

original: gsang sngags kyi cho 'phrul gyis 'bebs pa dang / dmag 'ching ba la sogs pa byed ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi cho 'phrul gyis 'bebs pa dang / dmag 'ching ba la sogs pa byed ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like the magical emanations of mantra, which cause the descent of the gods, the binding of armies, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa ni mthu chen po rang la mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa ni mthu chen po rang la mnga' ba ste /
translated: The play of the Tathagata is the mastery of great power.

original: gcig gis ji ltar bdud mtha' yas pa pham par byas pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / yid mgyogs pa la sogs pa mdzad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ji ltar bdud mtha' yas pa pham par byas pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / yid mgyogs pa la sogs pa mdzad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the way in which he defeated the limitless demons, performed the great miracles, and acted with swiftness of mind, etc.

original: de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bstan to //
translated: All of these are taught in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod //
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod //
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' yas pa rnams ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par 'grub par bya ba yin zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' yas pa rnams ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par 'grub par bya ba yin zhes dgongs te /
translated: It is thought that the limitless deeds of the Buddha are to be perfectly accomplished from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir @87a * //üîΩzhe na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @87a * //üîΩzhe na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that?

original: lan ni de ni bstan du med pa ste zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan ni de ni bstan du med pa ste zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The answer is: It is not something that can be shown.

original: bstan pa ni 'di dang 'di la zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'di dang 'di la zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Showing is a conceptualization, thinking ‚Äúit is here, it is there.‚Äù

original: de 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That does not exist here.

original: gang gi phyir de bstan du med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bstan du med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it cannot be shown,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi ston pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi ston pa yin te /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be shown.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par rol pa dag mi ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par rol pa dag mi ston te /
translated: It does not show the emanations and displays of the Tathagatas.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la mngon par 'du byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir bstan pa'i ched du sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la mngon par 'du byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir bstan pa'i ched du sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not engage in application for the purpose of showing non-conceptuality, because it is not reasonable to form volitions in the non-conceptual.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa med par mdzad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bstan to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa med par mdzad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bstan to zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata's performance of miraculous emanations without forming volitions is said to be shown in the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pa skal ba dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba la sogs par 'dod pa skal ba dang ldan pa la /
translated: For those fortunate ones who desire to see the Tathagata, etc.,

original: 'grub pa 'di yang mos pa med par mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grub pa 'di yang mos pa med par mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this accomplishment is not accomplished without devotion,

original: 'jam dpal dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, those bhik·π£us or bhik·π£u·πáƒ´s,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: upƒÅsakas or upƒÅsikƒÅs

original: dge bsnyen ma gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: who‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gong du bstan pa 'di las chung du na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gong du bstan pa 'di las chung du na /
translated: In this teaching on the perfection of wisdom,

original: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa de dag kyang phyir mi ldog par nga 'chad na /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa de dag kyang phyir mi ldog par nga 'chad na /
translated: if I say that those who do such things as uphold even just a four-line verse will not regress,

original: gang dag rang dang gzhan dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo bsgrub cing /
analyzed: gang dag rang dang gzhan dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo bsgrub cing /
translated: what need is there to mention those who, for themselves and others, accomplish the essence of the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin nyid du bya ba'i phyir /üîΩsgrub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du bya ba'i phyir / sgrub pa lta ci smos /
translated: and practice in accordance with that?

original: 'dis ni de dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin par ma gsungs kyang gsal lo //
analyzed: 'dis ni de dag phyir mi ldog pa nyid yin par ma gsungs kyang gsal lo //
translated: This makes it clear that even though it is not stated that they will not regress, they will not.

original: zhal nas gsungs pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa las kyang /
translated: From the words of the Buddha,

original: tshigs su bcad ba rtsa ba drug pa'i bar du yod pas de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad ba rtsa ba drug pa'i bar du yod pas de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: there are verses up to six lines, so in order to eliminate those,üîΩit says, ‚Äúthose who‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig bzhi pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa zhes smos so //
translated: The four-line verse is mentioned.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni bstan zin to //
translated: Grasping, etc. have been explained.

original: yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni pha rol la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu ston pa ni pha rol la'o //
translated: Correct teaching is for others.

original: de ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa'o //
translated: That is the interest in others' aims.

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu gdon mi za bar nges par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu gdon mi za bar nges par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those sons or daughters of good lineage should be known as definitely destined for enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul ni spyod yul gang na gnas nas sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa dang / grub nas kyang gang la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul ni spyod yul gang na gnas nas sangs rgyas nyid 'grub pa dang / grub nas kyang gang la gnas pa'o //
translated: The domain of the buddhas is the sphere in which buddhahood is accomplished and in which it abides once accomplished.

original: de la gnas pa ni de thos nas skrag pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis mos pas de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni de thos nas skrag pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis mos pas de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abiding in that is interest in it through hearing it without fear, etc. because one abides in it.

original: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang dang gzhan gyi don la mos pa yin no //
translated: That is interest in one's own and others' aims.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas @87b kyi chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / phrin las thams cad la nges par 'gyur ba ni gzhan du mi ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas @87b kyi chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / phrin las thams cad la nges par 'gyur ba ni gzhan du mi ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who are definitely oriented toward all the intrinsic natures and activities of the buddhas' qualities are not turned back by others.

original: 'di ni rang gi don la mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi don la mos pa'o //
translated: This is interest in one's own aim.

original: 'jam dpal ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba zhes bya ba la sngar mthong ba'i lam gyi skabs su phyag rgya bzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba zhes bya ba la sngar mthong ba'i lam gyi skabs su phyag rgya bzhag pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, I have already set forth the seal of the Buddha‚Äôs permission in the context of the path of seeing.

original: yang gzhag go zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
